well lesse hot winter summer lesse cold yet notwithstanding shall infinitely better hath helpe sunne aire two thing doe greatly amend make better water necessitie force water lye deepe low wee must gather assurance neuer drie vp altogether happen head fountaine somewhat farre farme may force water come thither little riuers rather conueniently cha el conduit made lead wood potearth best made aller tree f rre tree pine tree distilleth perro en tree haue oylie humour hot easily resisteth hurtes water might cause next made potearth water carried along cause breeding obstruction must two finger thicke sharpe one end length halfe foot goe one worst sort made lead water carried along purchaseth lead euill qualitie ceruse thereof oftentimes causeth bloudie flux like disease beleeue galen cause call inhabitant paris squitters vse fountainewater runneth leaden pipe point notwithstanding seemeth without doubt seeing ceruse cannot breed made lead without vineger see also diuers country doe drinke water without troubled bloudie flux whatsoeuer wee must set well together soulder pipe compound made vnquenched lime grea e hogge perrosen white egges lyme white egges oyle filing yron arch rayse pillar matter support waterpassages sufficient haue found head well fountaineswhat water best must consider goodnesse wholesomenesse water aristotle teacheth v seeing greatest part life dependeth vpon vse element requisite master household haue care procure good water much water must seruants drinke bread familie doe eat kneaded therewith greatest part victual boyled therein best wholesome water others raine water falling summer thundereth lightneth verie much yet notwithstanding raine water causeth costiuenes e obstruction especially kept cesternes newly made reason mortar wherewith ouerlayd doth also corrupt quickly onely excepted falleth may corrupted reth voice bringing hoarsenesse little co gh next goodnesse fountaine water falleth mountaines runneth along amo gst stone rock next goodnesse well water issueth hanging part mountaines springeth bottome valley fourth different sort water riuer worst rest poole marish ground yet runneth worse rest apt ect water snow ice vnwholesome coldest earthie hauing beene prepared heat vertue sunne conce ning water well fountaines seeing found good alwaies place shall know good haue neither tast ell colour whatsoeuer notwithstanding verie cleere nature ayre taking quickly colour anie thing one shall cast also cleane warme winter cold summer easie make hot soone becomming cold againe peason beanes like thing doe boyle easily put space brasen copper siluer vessell well scoured leaueth discoloured part spot hath beene boyled ca ldron made verie faire cleane doth make etling shew filth bottome vse drinke haue cleere voice sound breast die colour face neat liuely finally together rest markes verie light consequent principall rest shall iudged excelleth foresaid markes quality know lightest weigh much much moistened ightest water weigh le e rest true lightnesse water truely tryed weight drinking causing time anie burthenous weight place short ribbes passeth bodie speedily also quickly hot quickly cold drie placesplaces giuen bring forth country abounding mountaines doe commonly bring forth stone easily perceiued rough boisterous handling earth also stone lying vpon vpper part thereof otherwise might haue fallen beene cast manner sometimes falleth men find vpon vntilled ground liuely shape fruit corne gathered together growne vnto stone bee seene neere mommirall brie wood growne vnto stone ought haue beene done better therefore small house good stuffe sumptuous well seated well fitted let haue euerie thing little costly place large roomes either become enuied superiours else length causeth master sell againe good roman husbandman saith householder must diminish charge euerie thing labour may euermore haue moe thing sell buy euerie day become strong powerfull field seeing lord meaning cost course building according reuenues ground value profit saith cato dwelling house set seeking ground ground caused goe seeke house roomes great plot building inclosure pleasure cost much build maintaine building lesse requisite profit ground great cause much losse fruit chap vi dutie father familie householder haue thus disposed roomes building wish desire lord farme may man great knowledge well acquainted giuen matter husbandrie ignorant hauing small practise also doth take chiefest delight thing spendeth time otherwise must necessitie commit himselfe mercie discretion farmer mocke face impaire ground house also heaping thereto world quarrel suit raise else must trust accomplisher businesse either gouerning waiting attending asking counsell armers thereabout wil make beleeue thing good halfe indeed read certainetie roman history earth neuer fruitful allured woon industrie famous roman citizen deliuered tyrannous handling gros eheaded peasant see eye notwithstanding altogether ignorant grow rich cost charge great spoile ground husband till nothing comparable ouerlooking eye prudent discreet lord one accustomed husbandry looketh contenteth himselfe estate may stand profit keepeth himselfe principall charge watchfulnes earnest desire preserue good hath alwaies care companie farmeth yet renteth ou thing haue nothing withall except little ouersight neither yet would haue himwhat thing fit farmed passe bargaine way notary writing meanes robbeth himselfe libertie let learne well know vnderstand nature choice men cattell ground let work possibly fall himselfe knoweth doe stand need else giue direction command vnto others least let vnderstand time season also manner thing accustomed done man seeth place whereby may giue light another neuer lighten well euen lord farme vnderstandeth neither knoweth season proper time thing belonging gouernment iurisdiction neither yet ordering thing execute euery thing accordingly shall neuer know well command doth nothing workman ouble grieue manner men mocke command thing done nothing purpose must afterward vndone el abide without profit great husbandman cat hath written ground ill entreated grieuously punished whose lord owner knoweth teach comand done must depend relie wholly vpo farmer therefore necessarie father familie owner farme expert euerie worke due euerie season yeare thus first earth applyed onely tillage shall know soyle wherein liueth stiffe strong heauie tough clay shall plowday euer munday twelfthday till valentine day breake vp peaseearth intendeth sow pea beanes must lye ait till haue receiued frost raine thereby mould may breake earth mixt earth light nature plowday valentine shall breake vp allow earth intends keepe yeare following valentine day till chaddes shall sow beanes pea fetch pulse whatsoeuer prouided alwaies sow beanes first pea next smaller pulse last shall chaddes day till fortnight ladie day commonly called annuntiation sow oat either vpon am land owne yeare tilth fallow ground prepared purpose fortnight annuntiation till fortnight shall sow barley either clay ground hassell mixt earth vpon light sand mid aprill till whitsontide may day till midsummer fallow stiffe clayes summerstirre lighter mixt earth midsummer till lammas shall summerstirre stiffe clayes foyle lighter earth lammas till ortnight michaelmas shall winterrigge land intends sow barley yeare following shall also season sow wheat rye ma yne shall also furrow cut sluces whereby drayne water arable land drier lye better euermore fruitfull experience husbandman find continuall practise hee thus knoweth dispose order arable ground hee shall also know husband pasture medow ground namely month ianuarie februarie shall first plash cut hedge quickset thereby may grow thicke strong bottomes shall cast molehils leuell kill mole prune fruittrees either haue decayed dead branch else superfluous succour growing robbeth tree much sap nourishment march ground verie fruitfull indifferent temperature shall lay ground intend haue hay fertile beare much burthen lay may day fully early ynough midsummer may mow fruitfull low ground translation thomas may mow lye higher lesse fertile obseruing season yeare moist may let high ground grow longer cut low ground sooner season burning drie must cut high ground sooner let low ground stand longer first burne root retaine moisture month iune iuly may also either weather hinderance detaine greater work shall lead forth dung compasse meanure tilth allow field also good season bringing home fuell especially prouisions lye farre lammas pull summer fruit reape corne graine either find ripen hewes day haue meanure vnlaid lead forth one load bestowed earth precious two former season weeke luke day begin skowre pond ditch plant replant fruit tree hedge left vnplasht spring plash excellent season allhallontide cut downe timber chiefely ash elme ewe else prepare cart plow harrow timber christmas brush hedge weed dead superfluous branch also end ianuarie good stubbing wood ground remouing bee also shall bare root fruit tree couer againe rich mould march following thus husbandman according opinion oliuer serres hauing enriched memorie knowledge shall liue free man bondslaue master prentice farmer baylie meane whilethe chiefe key rest abode owner farme vpon inhe itance haue royaltie chiefetie whole doth ithdraw himselfe home secretly retur e thither shall seeme ood vnto keepe people continually office charge cause among rest building wee haue counselled rouide backe gate end inclosure let goe see towne cept vpon earnest affaire let commit suite followed without great losse cannot let passe neglect faithfull attur eyto order suite shall giue nothing onely counterpane euidence eing townewhat time householder keepe farme may best go abroad towne elsewher let goe see man therein except winter r time haruest seed ime first arder dispatcht end one meanes may attend vpon cause contro ersie goe getting debt wish carry himselfe leasant courteous vnto folke commanding thing choler boisterous rough handling preuaile little men stiffenec ed iades let speake familiarly vnto let laugh teacheth vertues power matter husbandrie end may handle manage order according motion two great gouernersof moone speake moone first place reason neerest vnto v rest planet coelestiall body doth worke effect like manner vpon v concerning body well vpon rest earthly thing certaine le e one moneth runneth course way sunne running yeare long hath light selfe taketh receiueth sunne giuing reuerberations reflection vnto earth vehemencie sunne contrarie looke much commeth neerer vnto coniunction itt e cause grow h wa th moone much lesse light force doth impart vnto earth hereupon commeth say moone encreaseth decreaseth indeed doth encrease decrease saue eclipse continually enlightned sunne brightnesse onely casteth spreadeth vpon whole face earth doth encrease decrease shining brightnes e according longer lesser time hath likewise lesse force mo e humor naturall thing worke effect much light encreaseth much doth moisture thereof spread communicate selfe aboundantly throughout outward part contrarie much waneth groweth lesse much naturall humiditie moisture doth withdraw betaketh selfe vnto inward part th cause men call moone mother nurse regent gouernesse humidity earthly body whereforeto slaughter ca ell new moone speake first fieldbeasts welladuised farmer shall kill time whatsoeuer porkes mutton beeues kine beast flesh whereof would make household prouision sustenance familie wane moone flesh killed decrease moone falleth away impaireth euerie day also craueth much fire time make readie withall neither ought man maruaile sta astonished hee consider well sawsage like kind meat doth grow lesse quarter boyled neither shall make account buy horseflesh foled brought forth decrease old age moone weake faint rest moreouer come growth neither store fruit cleanse pruneto cleanse tree cut foot fruittrees toward later end moone become better laden fruit shall make nursery moone ouer earth fruitsto gather fruit grape shall gather apple peares fruit also grape decrease moone thereby wine better kep otherwise would danger sowre rot moneth following time men wont cut vine shall gather carrie house whatsoeuer would haue endure last longto sow corn winnow fanne searce lay vp corne vnder locke time moone shall decrease hee shall sow corne graine shall weed fanne searce gather together corne locke shall grind corneto grind corne better keepe flowre end old moone verie true bread encreaseth profiteth ground moone encreasing new shall mow cut downe corne sythe moone wasting shall pull line pulse yet indeed pulse gathered reaped growth moone digestion concerning hearbes shall sow moone new gather moone encreaseth light farre greater force wast wane time shall gather cucumber gourd melon pompions root grow head whether leekes onion n wan radish turneps lillie saffron like except onion dealt withall cleane contrarie become great deale grosse better fed declining augmenting full moone time haue force greatnesse bodie notwithstanding sowne transplanted wane moone towards later end great deale strong sharpe biting growth full moone furthermore shall cut downe medowes feeding cattell moone newt mow med w hee shall dungto dung ground make fat encrease much moone giueth lesse power vnto dung soften earth doth tree seed bud grow multiplie euerie one place shall water meadowes decrease moone shall content know force efficacie euerie quarter moone hath vpon beast tree pl nt hearbes fruit thing contained inferior world shall also carefull obserue power euerie day moone hath onely vpon beast plant also disposition gouerning man make vse thereof time necessitie time place occasion offereth following infallible obseruations h u beene long continued father neuer attayned vnto first day moone adam created man fall sick vpon day sicknes e long partie shall recouer dreames dreameth night shall found ioyfull child borne day shall liue long second day eue created good take voyage vpon day either sea land traueller shall haue happie successe place shall lodge ourne day good encrease posteritie likewise happie fauourable shall haue suit vnto prince great personage likewise good build set vp vpon also make garden orchard parkes till earth sow th ft robberi committed day long vnfound cannot concealed fall sicke quickly healed dreame night time must respect shall come effect child borne vpon day thriueth groweth iollily third day cain borne vpon day man enterprise worke either gardening planting except purposeth lose falleth sicke shall vndergoe beare great paine griefe vnto end little little keeping good order diet shall recouer health dreame dreamed day night shall come naught likewise child borne shall long life fourth day abel borne good day begin worke make mill goe vpon water fugitiue runaway also lost strayed beast shall quickly found partie falling sicke vpon bed shall hardly escape dreame good shall come passe contrarie euill shall come passe child borne day shall pro e traytor fifth day lamech borne vpon day partie haue committed thing hap accident lye doth lose labour flight shall punished aliue dead robberie committed day shall found shall fall sicke vpon day shall neuer rise againe dreame dreamed shall doubtfull child borne shall die veri quickly sixt day ebron borne good vpon day send child schoole goe hunting theft robberie committed day shall b quickly found likewise sickness shall taken shall soone healed dreames man shall dreame day disclosed th child shall borne shall long life seuenth day abel slaine cain good day let bloud foreseene moone fit signe coast quarter soeuer malefactor theefe doth flye theft committed shall quickly found sick soone healed th dreames certaine true good buy swine make food manuer beast child borne shall long life eight day methusalem borne good trauellers patient taken disease shall languish long time dreames therefore shall proue true child shall shew good ignes iudgemen physiognomie ninth day nabuchodonosor borne said day indifferent th dreames night come passe incontinently partie shall fall sicke escape die within eight dayes therefore shall languish beare mournefully child borne vpon day shall long life tenth day noe borne good thing done day shall prosper dreames shall effect vpon shall fall tribulation aduersi ie shall need feare shall long endure likewise falleth sicke shall die within tenne dayes well succoured child borne vpon day shall trauaile many farre coast country eleuenth day samuel borne good change one house good ioyfull dreame shall fall true come passe within dayes partie lying downe sicke vpon bed shall continue long time yet notwithstanding h shall escape child borne vpon day shall good spirit apt forward good science long life twelfth day dangerous therefore must doe thing vpon day canaan borne shall fall sicke therein shall great danger die within twelue dayes dreames thereof shall true according signification child borne day shall altogether hypocritically enclined thirteenth day euill begin worke falleth sicke vpon day shall continue long languishing dreames thereof shall accomplished within nine dayes child borne day shall liue long four teenth day god blessed noe workes falleth sicke day shall amend againe quickly dreames thereof doubtfull child borne day perfect thing fifteenth day shall indifferent say neither good bad sicke shall die vpon sicknesse whereinto fell day dreames thereof certaine accomplished within tenne dayes child borne thereon shall subiect woman sixteenth day iacob borne cause maketh good buy ame horse ox cattell sicke shall great danger death change ayre house dreames shall come passe child shall liue long seuenteenth day sodome gomorrha destroyed ill attempt doe thing physicke taken doe good vnto patient dreames verified within th ee dayes child prosperous thing eighteenth day isaac borne good leisure goe businesse sicke shall danger death dreame shall true child shall trauaile farre shall get grea good nineteenth day king pharoah borne day dangerous wherefore good auoid companie drunkard liue peaceably without thing diseased soon recouer dreame proue tru child malicious mocker twentieth day prophet raisedbeasts prouided enemy poultrie thereby preuent danger ca fox weasel poleca fulmers beast giuen rauin abroad night also kite henharrow owle sometimes let swap broodhouse catch carrie away chicken end may lose must cut great feather one wing vse oftentimes flye ouer wall also meanes may keepe garden would take vp custome would keepe laying surer preuention foresaid mischiefesthe wing cock capon must cut ouer aboue hath beene said good clip wing cock capon must fasten set rowes thorne faggot vpon top wall said garden place elsewhere broodhousethe broodhouse shall built aside farmeplace farre lodging chiefe lord bird loathsome doe foule euerie thing spoyle whatsoeuer household furniture turned toward east winter northerne quarter neere vnto ouen kitchin possible end heat thereof helpeth lay smoake verie wholesome pullen may reach euen vnto shall haue little window right vpon east pullen may come forth court morning goe againe euening shall shut night end may nestle themselues safely danger beast apt offer wrong without side next court shall haue pretie ladder pullen may flye vp window house roust rest themselues night time hennehouse must well layd lome smoothed within without end cat fulmers snake dangerous beast may come neere vnto pultrie neere vnto hennehouse middest court certaine tree arbor sowre grape end pullen may haue shadow vnder summer chicken may haue couer defence kite owles rauenous bird good sleepe vpon plaine floore ordure dung may hang vnto foot thus would grow haue paine foot become gow ie cause must set along hennehouse foot higher floore two foot one another quare pearches round round pullen could sit fast vpon right oueragainst hennehouse little way shall prepare dunghill benefit pullen sort manner cast great deale earth great hole purpose made end shall besprinkle bloud ox beast killed onely hide afterward shall cast reasonable quantitie oates vpon shall turne said earth vppermost lowermost small time engendred great quantitie wormes pullen shall haue picking worke long time gras e shall sticke correct fat shall get wormes haue picked shall see prouision wormes faile may begin againe watering earth bloud sowing oates thereupon first haue fa capon pleasant flesh mulberry season doe plant mulberrie tree court capon manner fowles feede vpon mulberry become maruellous fat excellent taste verdure euerie dozen hennes one good cocke sufficient howsoeuer former day doe allow one euerie fiue must colour white yet gray red tawnie black body wel compact crest combe vpright red thicke notched toothed gasht cut well raised necke make profit bird much flesh thereof pleasant eat especially necke breast feather thereof maller better wholesome sleepe vpon goose layeth egges great quantitie good delicate hennes yet vse make cake cause called men old time bird twofold double kind liuing feeding swannes haunt loue resort particular place onely watrie wandringswannes solitarie place great store seene place towards angoulesme coignac riuer sharant reported floored swannes paued trout sameure fraunce also flanders towards valentiavalentia vale swan say haue beene respect called valley swannes may made tame may put either pond fennes indeed destroy spoyle verie much fish sometimes feed vpon greene corne gosling wild goose doe make great spoil wast therein sufficient two paire take pleasure pooleshow manie swannes ynough together foure verie great one paire onely ynough fishpond must haue house apart orchard garden couered ouer little free disturbance often made cleane refreshed defile verie much haue ynough whereon feed place abode must cast softened bread smallest fish great eating fowle chargeable kept maketh neast himselfe hatcheth yeare three egges time verie beautifull pleasant bird certaine kind swanne hath right foot diuided finger fashioned nailes clawes tallons bird prey haue whereupon striking water catcheth footeth prey left foot fashioned common manner others roweth vpon water one seene killed abbey iuilly neere dampmartin yeare kind swanne feedeth water vpon prey altogether wild cannot handsomely tamed common swanne one socrates plato saith bird dedicated apollo gift diuination hath foreseeth death singeth verie sweetly melodiously perceiueth hand seeming thereby foresee good death doth bring haue obserued doth onely foresee owne death also death men especially appeareth place wont haunt witnesse hereof bartholomew day yeare two three dayes seene manie swannes flying swimming diuing riuer seyne betwixt clou port nully crane much vnlike swannescran bird continuall haunt yearely remouing country hot vnto country cold departure september returne shortly spring seed time although doe addict themselues vnto watrie place yet feed part drie land yeeldeth thing affoorded water liue feed vpon corne doe wild goose cause make great account crane although hee stay certaine time yet hee layeth anie moe two egges yeare long wherefore willing keepe may doe rather please sight withall anie hope encrease neither lay sit anie moe two egges flesh verie hard digestion especially new killed eat stay time taking hang vpon arme figgetree may grow tenderer also eate rather long time haue beene dressed while yet warme see flye aloft ayre without making anie noyse looke faire weather see rest themselues vpon ground ye assured raine farme neere vnto marishes place snake lizard adder like beast abound may set vp small spire turret house plant vpon piece high mounted ground wellspread treestorkes great height alluring storkes may helpe free house said venimous beast kill feed young one therewith yet perswade selfe easily draw allure yet retaine keepe summer passed vpon winter returne packing another countrey notwithstanding hauing beene disturbed time ayring bringing vp young one doe euerie yeare repayre wonted ayres long light farre countrey doe ayre neast themselues willingly also top high tower frequented iudging place suffer man doe annoyance meane time need take care neast laying sitting feeding bird carefull ynough themselues needing help doe come goe sort one cannot perceiue sort may rather see commen foresee comming much comming going night doe thinke haue tongue make account eat seeing verie euill iuice venimous feeding yet good hee shall haue eaten storke shall haue eye bleared running yeare obserued bird young doe feed old breed cannot flye get prey chap xviii feasants point great curiositie keepe feasantshennes numidia columella calleth hennes numidia hath pleasure profit must one almost doth nothing else bird chargeable maintaine haue house selfe raised high leaning inclosure wall court long also troughes may ayre sunne giueth euerie seuerall bird must haue owne roome yet must one dore vnto hennehouse cleansing thereof giuing meat rest house shall open vpon forepart yet sort shall sure fast thick latted clouen boords height fadome verie well couered aboue feasant cock hennes hard tamefeasant cock hennes asie make tame hatched else taken within yeare elder sort grow sullen malecontented doe accord buckle themselues either lay sit young must gently handled vntill well trained easily content apply themselues enduring constrained ayre one like taken must one cocke euerie two hennes henne hath one season wherein vseth lay march time beginneth continueth vntill haue orderly layd twentie fitteth together else fifteene owne others another kind put vnder sitteth thirtie dayes time sitting must vse like diligence doe henne must within owne house young one hatched shall fed flower barly boyled cooled afterward feastiuall dayesto fat feasant cock hennes banquet feast onely brood gaue vnto first day honied water strong wine cause forget naturall place flower barly tempered water ground beanes cleane barly beautifull feather quickly angrie farre taking good hold foot goodly behold verie good eat serueth watch inner court hee spying stranger come lodging fayleth crie aduertise house true kept little cost meat great eater quickly digesting meat noysome house spoyleth garden little medow ground frequent hee breaketh roofe high place house cocke ouerranke nature doth breake hennes egges thereby keepe sitting may freely enioy vse cocke liueth long time twentie fiue twentie yeares henne somewhat lesse one somewhat troublesome reare bring vp while young need haue great care taken haue left dam except peahennes hennes doe lay seldome sitting downe low manifest egges found oftentimes dropt downe vnder pearch happeneth falling shee asleepe bird bring foorth verie well three yeares old nothing verie men vse powder larde much season spice much pleasure goodnesse flesh peacocke meat fit kind birdwhat meat fit turkies good hennes made like diligence propertie abroad feede vpon grasse wormes hearbes die end pigeon wherewith mind store douehouse must young one taken halfe downe halfe feathered together old one dam put libertie douehouse rather great cowpes cause fed fetch water skilfull handler pigeon twice day long till become eat drinke themselues meanes soone haue forgotten old house also old one yeeld themselues willingly tarrie douehouse wherein first lodge put old one would doe translated another place would find way take flight directly former first home soone made way get forth farre soeuer beene brought pigeon good encrease store ash browne blacke coloured roughfooted bird verie easily perceiued flye farre must make choice may flight feare cold grow easily thriue better sooner able get owne meat aboue thing let pinched meat moneths aprill may old verie manie sitting else haue alreadie hatched make familiar tameto tame pigeon giue honey little piece bread afterward fetch cummin seed allure verie much sometimes wheat among ridled scrap let goe till fifteene day putting time shall cut wing shall keepe net spread ouer windowes end may haue light day yet able get forth end fifteene day shall permit field taking away said net yet night approch time cloudie darke inclined raine goe farre place late inlargement neither possibly returne vnto douehouse hide head night whereof learne marke place receit forsake leaue hauing neuer ast anie former choice anie farre remoued place returne thither againe lay vpon window made light vpon comming cote loafe made red earth cummin seed well bruised honey brine well boyled together dried ouen hauing picked vpon lumpe neuer fayle returne thither againe much giuen pleasing taste verie sent smell remayning billes bee meanes allure others along euen cote foresaid commoditie sake learne neuer leaue forgoe shall also keepe flying away giue lentil steeped honied water boyled cuted wine else drie figges mixed meale malt honey say also pigeon neuer goe away set vpon turret douehouse head bat branch wild vine dores windowes cote rubbed annoynted oyle balme also pigeon flye field bring home others rub wing said oyle balme giue going thither fetch besprinkled wine shall haue steept liquor seed agnus castus pigeon haue smelt sauour pigeon mouthes fayle come pigeonhouse perfume oftentimes douehouseperfumes douehouse iuniper rosemarie sometimes little fine frankincense doth mightily retaine keepe causeth loue owne house anie shall perceiue begin lay giue th n libertie shall see casting morning evening little cleane corne vnder barne wall farre dung causing waterpot wherein bath refresh themselues oftentimes made cleaneto draw pigeon place draw diuers others place insomuch twentie paire fortie dayes haue stored house twice yea thrice manie bring forth young thrice good foure time yeare shall need care anie thing keepe douehouse cleane cause behooueth hath charge douehouse goe weeke least morning time reliefe pigeon seeking meat abroad countrey thereabout seeing doe ordinarily keepe noonetide douehouse enter houre make wild estrange young one yea old one themselues going shall whistl hem cast something eat end may accustomed nd acknowledge hee shall emptie fill vp againe waterpot leare water shall pare floore shall cast shall find dead hall make cleane hole end may gather anie flea louse punies mothes especially summer shall put vp againe hole uch may fallen shall cull barren may put lace themselues may fat afterward either eat sell perceiue traine anie snake adder shall set long earthen pot vpon tayle bottome shall put within pigeon plaeing right trade walke adder shall set kind little footpace uch thing whereby shee may creepe vp vnto top pot cast elfe afterward adder cannot come forth againe shall cleanse nd rid douehouse true pigeon doe require cost winter hen either frost snow corne shot cannot find anie hing field paine passing two moneths continuance bout need feed corne drosse winepresse stone grape thing may store prouision ynough athered vintage time fat amend fennie wet place part corne ground medowes young plant tender hearbes refresh relieue tree subiect coldnesse moisture may also make vse thereof sciatica making cataplasme thereof seed cress mustard putting thereto little philosopher oyle also headach wrought mortar oyle kernel peachstones apply place paineth chap xxii neatheard notwithstanding wee haue yeelded giuen ordering kine vnto huswife ox kept ordered meat manner notwithstanding country farmes kept plough sale prouided man hath charge thinke vpon order obserued noted hath almost much pain labour take horse true cow great charge maintaine keepe neither respect meat neither yet handling managing neither yet furniture force strength whereby oxe doth cleaue ground draw cart requireth one doe nothing attend notwithstanding must feed two one three best ox bourbon forest much one good horse france beau like manner doubt labour ox admitted meere necessitie forceth conuenient commodious keeping heards horse horse come farre countrey though feeding good singular ox flanders elsewhere yet falleth haue horse doe worke doe like better thereof oxe euen prouence languedoe auuergnac men doe vse labour mule young colt rather ox kine effect dispatch worke well yet speedily howsoeuer yet labour oxe maruellous good auaileable profitable strong ground draw ploughes deepe earth turne ouer great furrowes may seene italie great ox long broad breasted gascoigne bourbon poitou aniou mayne againe men ancient time vsed beast ox ox sparing profit farmer contented feed vpon pasture without anie food prouender besides great profit good prouision comming either shouldershot bruised ani part growne impotent vnable worke reason old age either sell kill salt vse profit commodity kind cattell meane horse doe affoord oxehouse must built stonethe oxehouse paued grauell sandie ground somewhat descending sloping moisture may stand must also stand vpon south may drie lesse subiect vnto cold frostie wind shall nine foot wide onely height oxe may stand vpright oxekeeper may haue space ynough goe round see serue fodder also end seeing ox striking one another horne weaker may haue space withdraw himselfe rackes must high ox cannot easily reach charge keepe oxenthe oxekeepers charge gentle louing vnto ox dressing giuing meat prouiding good litter either straw thing rub euerie euening lye downe morning eurrie wipe cleane gently washing tayles oft warme water keepe house cleane let hennes swine come therein feather kill ox dung diseased swine engendreth murraine plague giue fresh straw vnto cattell cast summer greene sprout tender hoot arbor vine others winter beane stalkes grasse euening morning let skilfull discerne plough ox haue labored much little may accordingly giue proportionable quantitie meat also shall necessarie may let take paine labour verie hot verie cold weather neither yet verie moist may let drinke quickly trauell heated soone come home hee shall cast little wine throa shall tie manger vntill time wearinesse ouerpast commeth together anie companie festiuall day rest shall grease horne vnder pasterne together hoofe else e shall put vnder onion rosted verie soft betwixt two coales tying thereto cloth let oftentimes make cleane refresh pasternes suffer cleaue rend end let euerie yeare cause repaired pauement oxehouse serue also keepe away beast wont annoy ox let remoue one farre ynough another least strike one another labour let water twice day summer winter cleare cleane coole water hath beene said heretofore oxe seeketh water clear bright horse troubled let carefully looke vpon comming field whether anie haue got anie thorne foot sweatie collar yoke haue caused anie hurt abou head chafed neck haue beene much prickt goad gad ie horne let accordingly apply something healing gelded oxe better meatthe gelded oxe profi able worke bull better marchandise better labour th bull whose flesh hard tough like hide troublesome driue wherefore hundred calues oxekeeper may haue shall eepe aboue two bull kine rest shall geld two yeares oldthe time geld ox time cannot doe commodiously would one autumne later end moone ash vine bran he mixt lytharge must applied wound three day pitch elted mixt said ash must let drinke day wherein e geldedthe manner gelding oxe must day also eat little meat manner geld take two streight rule wood quitches pin er string stone afterward open purse cut stone n sort leaue vpper end thereof whereto said string fastned meanes calfe much subject effusion bloud neither yet altogether spoyled courage hauing pride taken away little left behind reserued may still expresse first naturall forme hauing gelded must feed well may fit labour feed according season time cheering cherishing sometimes giuing little salt sometime robbing head whole hand str aking backe rubbing rest louing gentle speech notwithstanding long house let horne tied close made fast cratch couple another greatnesse grosenesse age strength tie one lead field tied together end may one loue another let oftentimes see ox draw plow till ground doe manner worke end may loose naturall wildnesse lead heare noise mill men forge thing make great rumbling neere vnto time would haue draw two yeares halfe three giue yoke beele fit beast age sixtie day shall fasten waine teame draw field foure day shall fasten vnto teame piece wood load end accustome put draw ox plough incouraging cherishing without stroakes vntill time bee made cunning trouble wearie much labour first yeare buy ox labourto buy ox take coast quarter farme cannot acquaint themselues easily strange ayre horse doe vpon occasion buy strange countrie buy bred barren plaine countrie thriue take well vvith euerie place whether ayre hot tender subtile thin furthermore remaineth chuse three yeares old thereabout sooner cannot traine labour though haue bought doe labour much first yeare especially time great heat feeding rather good hay grasse grow able little little endure paine feare heat lesse continue sound cherefull longer time yea spend lesse cartell feeding vpon grasse shall gather greater store hay meadowes better beast broused grasse young peeping ground shall know old looking mouthesto know age oxe within ten moneths first yeare change foreteeth sixe moneths next end three yeares change middle best age teeth white long euen grow old shey become short vneuen blacke labouring ox must fat leanelabouring ox eat softly leasure doe abide continue better strength good oxe must meane size staturethe description oxe gentle handle readie quicke spoken crauing goad yet notwithstanding quicke also prickt going forward readily regard nature well limmed short broad square bodie stout stiffe hauing round muzzle great eares hairy match wide curled brow great blacke eye haire curled waued horne strong quicke reasonable greatnesse blacke br ke hanging downe euen knee head short well compacted shoulder breast great dewlap belly round rumpe firme sound leg long taile next thereto bay piecoloured spotted white worst gray yellowish indifferent hide skin thicke well fed betwixt foure eight yeares old age full strength lustinesse oxe thus madethe liuing age oxe serue disease rotto preserue sheepe rot caught impossible cured shall morning soone driue fold bring sheepehouse plac would haue feed little dogge chase vp downe space houre till haue almost tyred rest fall food owne pleasure thus shall doe euening also reason whereof morning sheepe comming hungrie fold finding thicke dew cobweb meldewes suc like filthinesse vpon grasse greedinesse deuoure eat nothing world sooner procureth rotting thus chased wearie onely foot beat corruption ground also wearinesse forbeare eat till time strength sunn beames haue exhaled drawne away fogges made grasse pure wholsome experiment hath approued ten thousand haue died want exercise one hath quelled hath beene vsed manner short breathshorinesse breath must slit nosthrils vsually done vnto horse else cut eares one another vnto sheepe haue aguethe sheepes ague good let bloud heele betwixt two clawes foot vpon eares afterward keeping drinking neuer little soueraigne remedie cure ague also many disease cause boyled water wine rammes stomach giue drinke vvith broth sniuell sheepethe sniuell shot also horse doth keepe selfe close within lung neither bloud letting drinkes expelled best remedie strangle beast disease continue two day well male female doe greatly desire delight driuelers leaue vpon edge rackes licke away thereby themselues shortly falling disease certaine marrers mule rather ke pers mule say must hung necke toad vine while liuing made vp bagge new cloth leaue space nine day others must put grasse horse one sheepe selfe seuerall pasture others say garleeke fresh sage must stamped together drinke made thereof vvith strong vinegar vvhether bee horse sheepe beast others giue drinke spoonefull aqua vitae mithridate vvill successe come thereof corrupting lung cough rotten helpe disease euen anoyding way cornes vse vex torment sheepecornes troubling sheepe healed allome brimstone vinegar mingled together pomegranet while young tender kernel growne stamped allome verie little vinegar gal burnt shaued put grosse red wine laid vpon cornes anthony fire anthony fire sheepe shepheards call flying fire hard cure neither salue burning yet medicine helpe nothing else done vnto foment milke goat good shed remoue flocke first sheepe shall taken disease bloud turning aboutfor bloud sheepe called sturdie taketh time greatest heat thereupon turne stumble leape without cause touch head foot shall find verie great heat must speedily take sharpe horne make incision veine aboue nosthrils middest thereof high possibly hereupon beast presently faint come vnto againe within short time sometime good sometimes doth oftner fall vnto euill shepheards haue tried letting bloud small quantitie temple haue found ease sometimes otherwise haue cough cold haue giuen spoonefull aqua vitae mithridate plaguefor murraine plague amongst sheepe like remedy beast men thinke sort cattell subiect vnto also swine respect filthinesse thereof stinking dung better preuenting thereof hath beene deuised thought good oftentimes perfume cratches vvith sweet hearbes hath beene spoken penniroyall wild balme rue iuniperberries oftentimes make eat amongst meat common melilot steed free course long vntill hoo e whole sound sheepe haue swallowed horseleachhorseleaches swallowed must put downe throte strong vinegar vvhich vvarme else oyle sheepe haue impostume vpper part fleshan full bit strength grasse feed vp fatten lambes quickly choyce sheepe soiles shall take agree leare colour earth rather bringing worse soyle better good soyle bad knowing withall fat earth though beare made red hot fire powder likewise verie singular maligne vlcers giuen r bellious likewise emplaister dog dung excellent squinancie chap xxviii carter horsekeeper haue heretofore spoken liuing creature profit vse men inhabiting countrie village followeth speake serue onely men inhabiting said village also inhabite dwell city great townes horse mule asse set horse rest seruiceable peasant countriedrudge also affording great seruices noble prince prelate short sort men beast peerelesse comelinesse beautie courage furniture profit commoditie therefore say let carter horsekeeper appertayneth charge countrie horse sober patient man louing beast well neuer beating well may acquaint lash whisking noise rod speech cal let time labor well may either draught trauell let currie cherefully merrily euerie morning sommer sometimes noone must giue drinke ordinarie houres rest let oftentimes vse wash foot sommer cold water sometime wine lee wine strengthen withall vrine dulled blunted night time putting owne dung hollow sole hoofe chafed heated put loue desire meat must wash throat vinegar salt let giue hay prouender chaffe oatsa farmer must know worke trade fadler farrier litter verie well dusted must let goe without shooes nailes let carefull traise cartsaddles collar bridle part geares harnesse torne rent rotten must also know sow small threed packthreed shoothreed
