necessitie must verie carefull find cause vvhen seeth one horse halt foot vvhat place foot handled tried complayneth himselfe put pasternes sometimes spechgrase sometimes dung must also take great heed beast doe cast old hoofethe casting hooues haue new growing cause thing giuen helpe growth new hoofe vvhen hath throat heated cause couered therewith haue cough trauaile haue taken cold raine tedious vveather giue eat fenugreeke aniseseed amongst prouender change vvhen past age also take acknowledgement loue one horse beareth towards another accordingly set one another stable appointed themto make clean ehis horse stable must euerie morning may cleane sommer carrying dung filth letting none remaine night giue fresh litter must also cast eye see whether horse doe grow leane fat fetch boyled water mixed amongst oat also millet pannicke rice sodden mingled meale beanes little salt missing take good sweet barley chaffe pea pulse well mixt drie beanes giue thereof good store euerie watering vvhen newly commeth labour sodden barley boyled corne onely good loosen skinne fat gather neuer indurance must content take vp lodging stable feare falling sicke intangling themselues halter growing beast let carefull wise ordering placing light sort may daunger locke vp keepe harnesse well made readie ouer night morning returne labour field thing haue mule young colt must put reserue labour horse fall sicke wearinesse dulnesse chafing must put among rest haue horse hath ill propertie faultthe fault horse shall carefull amend fearefull timerous abide one getteth vpon backe goe place shall hang within prettie little stone doe good shall hoodwinke behind taile flame fire sharpe pricking thing w nie much shall tie head stone hole man vpon backe rise come aloft shall hit rod vpon forelegges lye downe must raised vp againe rough word stroke goe backward shall tye cord codds vvhich shall long th reaching betwixt forelegges rideth may hold hand horse shall goe backwarda horse going backward shall pull hard hand make goe forward vvithout doubt goe forthright amend fault horse gelded must beat thigh vvith long staffe taken fire verie hot burnt end shall giue feele whisking rodd betwixt eares horse hard shooe troublesome handle dresse stable shall put one eares little round pebble make sure one hand keepe eares thus shall make gentle meeke lambe also carter part gouerne heard mare colt carefully th inconuenience may befall shall put feed shall send grasse shall due time large marish ground notwithstanding marish ground doth soften hoofe verie much maketh tender sighted begetteth water foot cause could like high hillie ground better time time haue raine dropping downe vpon drie time rather voi free incombred vvood body tree legges yet hauing soft sweet grasse rather high great strong grasse notwithstanding mare frolicke couragious horse yet goe beyond farre race stand great deale longer againe chargeable keepe horse fed best hay content themselues run pasture yeare long true winter ground couered snow also time continuall raine must put one house giue hay good eat sommer keepe good coole shadow place well growne good grasse serueth vvith cleare vvaters n uer vpon rough ragged mountaines vvell doe hardly feed also foale hardly clime without great paine come downe without endangering themselues cast coltsthe co ring mare shall suffer mare take horse ofter euerie two yeare according opinio curious horseman yet better experienced allow conueying mar euerie yeare keepeth wombe open giueth foale large bed lye keepe breed best kind race bring base degenerate kind againe see ne mid march end time mare couered horsed may easily feed colt hauing tender soft grasse haruest end eleuenth twelfth moneth foale milke faster better conditioned begetteth also nourisheth fairer colt thriue euen selues would wish stalions also thus attended stronger doe abound well concocted slimie nature thinne waterie withall couer courage beget greater colt hardie strongthe signes mare readie take horse shall know mare readie take horse yeeld whitish humor place generation priuie part swolne wont also hot ordinarie eat much wont shall let take horse twice day euening morning let drinke shall continued tenne day past refuse shall put aside foale shall take away horse least furious rage make doe conceiue horse lesse three yeares olda horse couer mare fit couer mare may continue good till twentie yeare old mare fit take horse two yeares old three foaling time may able feed well nothing worth purpose tenne yeares old horse begotten old mare loose heauie one good horse ynough twentie mare time couer must well fed time approcheth must fatted barly fetch ciches end may better serue purpose stronger disposed shall couer stronger colt begetteth haue courage feeble heart must rub secret part mare new cleane spunge rub muzzle stalion mare admit horse must bruise seaonion rub secret part therewith warme haue horse colour would desire couer mare couering colour time horse shall couer mare whereof desire haue good racea mare breed must vnder two yeares old hath beene said aboue tenne twelue vnderstand withall colder complexion horse faileth worke must well made bodie broad spread toward one hauing comely pleasant looke flanke rumpe large well fed little leane end may hold horsing better haue trauelled long time beare euerie two yeares end may better feed colt colt must feed well must trauell runne leaue extremitie cold keepe house raineth snoweth long anie great cold weather may better bring forth perfect coltthe marereadie foale mare foaling hath cast colt must bruise polipodie mingling warme water cause drinke hornethe mare doth foale haue foaled well may touch colt hand touch neuer little hurt soone hath foaled house must succour drink warme water mingling salt therewith meale also euening morning space three day least must giue good hay sufficient corne keepe cleane good litter may rest ease good feeding doth cause colt prosper strengtheneth colt foaledto order new must left mare warme wide place end cold may hurt neither yet mare reason straitnesse place shall stronger shall accustomed eat hay end dam milke failing may haue learned feed vpon firmer nourishment shall let run mare pasture may mourne lacke sight colt commonly mare sicke loue colt cannot see shall eighteene moneths old shall begin waine put house built col afterward shall ame putting halter necke rather wooll coard may feele hard thing annoy abide tied must make fast two thong leather hempe bridle manger may acquainted touching handling also may learne afraid noise shall made vvill good also set amongst others alreadie tamed seeing haltred length accustome selfe subjection yet must speake faire touch hand sometimes rubbing backe head bellie sometimes numpe legges foot sometimes raising vp making cleane rubbing verie mildly gently short making much vntill become tame know boy horseman currieth rider must backe vvithall vnderstand vvords voyces smelling know get vpon sometimes shall set child vpon backe end may learne endure beare one giue good hay good grasse lead water one alreadie managed fitted hand hath drunke giue oat euening straw litter vp knee morning rubbe legges whole bodie litter lead drinke three yeares old must breake acquaint fit worke shall thinke meet example would appoint make serue sometimes take journey vpon could wish giue burning fire vpon leggesto burne colt hot yron shall commit skilfull farrier especially spring autumne decrease moone time young horse full two yeares old must done wel leg behind course burning doth harden strengthen loose flesh soft close set together doth bring downe puffed vp drieth hath much moisture dissolueth gathered together burneth away wasteth rottennesse healeth old ache curing restoring declined part bodie lessening growne great suffering grow add hereunto scabbe farcie malanders accustomed seise vpon leggs cannot haue power breed vpon haue thus burnt knobd hot yron carrie pasture houre deaw vpon grasse doe great deale good thing man giue vnto stable also shall cause burning shall appeare lesse shew yet shall good setting legge retained opinion amongst frenchman slitting horse nosthrils full growne make fit course race occasion libertie wind helpe broken winded horse fallacie deception hath vertue rather worketh contrarie dismembring organ instrument whereby draweth vp aire doth breed greater difficultie breathing painefulnesse whereof may perceiued standeth still without trouble molestation therefore would haue horsegroomes forbeare practise hold rather disgrace benefit vnderstood nature hath made euerie thing perfect without want super luitie alter thing maine workmanship rather ouerthrow helpe building geld make gelding may liue quietly amongst mare horse also itting desire peaceable horse may doe full yeare old secret part doe openly shew themselues better performance thereof vvere better vvrith mortifie codds altogether pincer geld notwithstanding full sufficient age gelding maine doe die extreame paine take away die yet remaine weakened strength whereas pinch onely pincer one free perill loosing life also continue bold ining vnto small part cord sinewes generati e yet best french horseman doe affirme geld colt cleane way incision calterizing best course taken maketh tendder sinest shaped best mettalled gelding say anie cord string generation left behind gelding proues rammish mare od foule headed thicke neckt grossely crested opinion english horseman must yeeld knowne onely gelding world boast haue either gift purchase therefore leaue skilfull groome consideration action chuse stand affected furthermore cause curried seruant pertaining belonging business wise gentle louing gentlenesse preuented fore eene young colt doe learne ill manner difficult thing take one ill qualitie therein respect behoueth seruants stable handle kindly speake gently vnto horse thereby make loue better meanes carriage wrought suffer themselues gouerned suffer meat giuen anie man lead drinke suffer themselues handled tou ed curried haue clothes put vpon backes either linnen one fly away else woollen one keepe warme make fast sur ingle better keeping morning new curried againe must litter vnder cleane whole thrust vnder manger foule together dung carried appointed dunghill neuer getting keepe stable verie cleane yet haue furnished man necessary euerie thing place yet euer way vn rstood soone haue cleansed stable cleane drest horse giuen prouender thinke meet leaue rest forget put downe litter pleasure may lye downe take ease anie horse olesome reliefe anie whatsoeuer giuing much comfort limbes ewe making swi digestion adding strength courage heart vitall spirit thereby great deale better enabled endure la ur lesse apt take surfets mischiefes much incident horse contrarie horse compelled stand day bare anchers foolish receiued opinion make hard endu nce horse taking delight lye downe humor descends legges swelling doe breed spauens curb ringbones gourding sinewes crease aboundantly maine good beast lucre saue one two bottle ggage straw spoyled made vtterly vnfit anie seruice would carefull thus keepe litter vnder horse also would haue obseruant see planchers lye euen leuell higher behind common custome men especially horsecoursers keepe horse sale vse albeit vneuen laying planchers g ueth horse beautie otherwise would haue ecting vp forepart higher hinder making shew odly wellraised forehead yet brings lamenesse therefore euermore eschewed horse currying meet ed made fast vnto high barre set vpright might haue ad holden high currie bodie rub cloth bath spunges well verie coole water head eye lippes iawes nosthrils e taile afterward combe verie diligently done rub body ouer especially legges wispes straw well bound trussed together otherwise grow full farcie slouthfulnesse seruants himselfe aboue thing must looked vnto whether lacke anie foot seeing oftentimes want one naile horse casteth shooe mid way great preiudice beast sometimes thereby danger losing whole foot especially trauelleth anie rough stonie ground horse hath lost goeth vnshod hurteth himselfe minute houre spoileth oftentimes seene quite lost least become vnfit horse thus curried spunged rubbed well smoothed uerie offence pickt trimmed taken away shall cloth clothes necessarie health answerable time yeare either double clothes single clothes lined clothes linnen together vsing winter fewer spring fewest summer yet better satisfaction may know number quantitie clothes shall vse shall view well horse bodie looke carefully haire lyeth especially vpon necke outward part vnclothed perceiue place haire standeth vpright areth look rugged assured horse wanteth clothes inwardly cold heart shall encrease clothes cease doe till haue haire lie straight smooth perceiued may sufficiently clad shall meanes exceed anie begin thus encrease clothes shall find come horse early morning weateth much especially flank areroots like vsuall place yet notwithstanding still stareth shall know sweating faint naughtie gendred corruption food else want moderate wholesome therefore meanes shall abate anie clothes rather till naughtie faint sweat leaue perceiue haire smooth cleane yet notwithstanding sweateth shall know clothes somewhat manie shall abate till sweating infallible rule secret worthie mind euerie good horseman groome intends keepe sound well prepared manner labour horse dressed hauing eaten little hay must led water ridden forth myle water would euer spring running riuer horse hath taken one good draugh two xercise water shall bring forth plaine ground gallop vp downe warme water bellie little space bring water againe let take another draught gallop againe thus doe till drinke gentlenesse walke softly home stable cloth vp manner horse wholesome giuing vnto great strength wind bodie also dissoluing cold tough humor ingendred corruption water taken without exercise lyeth cold troublesome bodie making horse quake tremble anie man may perceiue anie time approue hauing giuen horse water lay hand bodie buttocke haue alreadie spoken full sufficient horse watering whence returned shall oates giuen well sifted fanned shall marked whether need may looked month see whether thing keepe eating accordingly take cure common prouerbe isa prouerbe horse goe vpon foot meat doth vphold cause endure trauell meet also giue metimes rare daintie thing may please may rdinarie one one doth make gentle tractable ame afterward suffer themselues gouerned easily vse kindly beat torment cast feare high speech threatening word else anie meanes long stable rather handle meeknesse well word touching hand g manner soeuer fit colt saddleto breake first backe colt good rider must first put vpon head rouler wood attempting doe anie thing time leaue two three houres vpon reines cord take away day next day somewhat late put againe leaue certaine time afterward taking reines must little place drawing along twentie thirtie pace thence sometime walking othersome time staying still vpon ddaine according shall see good according stubbornenesse frowardnesse easinesse gentlenesse colt soone come stable shall haue halter taken putting accu omed headstall giue rather hay eat lead water giue ordinarie oat third day shall onely foresaid halter accustomed houre also saddle without stirrup crupper girding gently kind manner fastening buck ing verie lightly shall yet doe nothing lead stable halter handling alwaies louingly leading gentlenesse whi er willingly goe come fallowes plowed round shall get hauing taken long small hisking wand shall first make stand still afterward shall make colt goe little pace little somewhat faster faster giuing gentle touch remembrance said small rod hee shew vnto making stand still againe shall hold vp ith courteous friendly word rubbing hand shall carrie acke againe vnto stable presently take said furniture put im ordinarie tiall headstall fourth day shall make readie day hauing spoken faire shall set little boy vpon im begin smite short take anie whit shall lead reines stable lead pretie way aking much hand touching head necke breast hall lead blocke made get vp long ridden without stirrup causing boy come himselfe shall get vpon verie lightly holding reines euen hand shall cause one giue small whisking rod shall touch stroake necke lacking reines little shall cause goe forward softly play anie lea ing trick shall stay bridle still speaking louingly vnto groweth quiet shall make goe softly set little aster faster vntill make pace hauing done good sort pre e shall bring againe stable hauing fastened manger shall couer take cold houre shall take saddle bridle rubbing fresh straw e ecially place wet sweat couering cloth rubbed legges foot shall let drinke giue eat shake vp litter accustomable vse french rider first breaking colt others expert induistrious art held little tedious find neerer way end purposethe best handling colt thus hauing made colt gentle louing stable abroad obedient willing handled led forth ordered pleaseth without affright dislike rebellion first set good sufficient saddle backe yrrop styrropleathers vp downe side strong crupper good breastplace well gyrt morning cause led forth groomes hand may acquainted familiar ornament afternoone day put mouth strong headstall reines either good watering trench watering snaffle ouer strong soft chasse halter lead forth gentlenesse newplowed field else ground like make colt trot ring hand foure fiue time rider rider go colt cherishes groome holding fast chasse halter neere colt head one hand staying styrrop rider offer put foot styrrop manie leisurable heaues lift take saddle anie colt seeme displeased rider shall descend againe make colt trot ring foure fiue time offer mount back againe ceasing thus doe till colt gentlenesse dot receiue shall rider groome cherish verie much groome shal offer lead colt forward find fault either action co tenance gathering together rumpe legges bodie though would leape plunge immediately groome shall stay rider shall alight shall compell trot ring take back againe ceasing thus doe till colt willingnesse presse forw content led rider backe whither way soeuer groome pleaseth motion rider shall voice thrusting forward foot hard vpon styrropleathers encourage enforce colt goe forward shaking rod ouer colt head make heare noise thereof ever anon colt thus led vp downe rider shall bridle hand stop make stand still cherish cause led forward againe colt growes willing goe forward groome shall withdraw hand colt head loosen chasse halter insomuch colt may feeling groomes leading may goe forward helpe couragement rider onely shall groome giue reine halter rider hand shall make colt goe forward euer cherishing doth according desire giuing threatening word doth contrarie thus shall labour apply colt till goe forward willingly gently courage according desire rider euer obseruing neere make colt goe straight forthright meanes turne twynd anie way contrarie owne first day giue leaue goe way expecting anie obedience goe forward either pace trot pleaseth also stand still firme anie time shall restrain worke brought passe first day rider shall field colt backe hauing cherisht much giuen little gr bread eat shall deliuer groome gentlenesse sha lead home dresse cloth feed well next day colt adled bridled aforesaid groome shall lead forth former place rider shall take backe day point shall make colt perfectly repeat ouer first day lesson hath done willingly obediently without compulsion resistance groome shall mount backe old staunch horse gelding leading way colt shall trot faire softly round field stopping gelding oft rider stoppeth colt goe forward againe sometimes leading way colt sometimes riding cheeke ioll colt till brought perfectnesse take way forward way rider pleaseth shall ride gently home light neere vnto stable dore set vp colt cloth dresse feed third day rider shall take colt back stable dore groome gelding back ride forth plaine high way smoother better gelding leading way colt let ride straight forthright least two myles stopping sundrie time cherishing colt gently returne home colt sometimes leading way ometimes gelding alighting stable dore set vp colt dresse feed thus doe twice thrice third day shall much better fourth day rider shall take colt groome gelding colt shall lead way gelding shall follow onely giue colt encouragement gelding shall come ride vp face colt eftsoones fall back behind againe day shall large spacious compasse trot colt round first one hand making bend come according bowing bodie turning hand euerie motion make selfe master whatsoeuer doth giuing true vnderstanding doth pleasure withall meanes forgetting cherish doth well euen instant presentnesse time performeth pleasure may thereby know rewarded kindnesse like manner doth anie thing contrarie shall chastise threatening voice sometimes noise shake rod extremitie vrgeth good lash two rod vnder bellie selfesame instant offendeth colt hath performed thing answerable liking shall returne home way came forth conueniently way thereby breed colt ignorance owne ease onely meanes preserue keepe restyuenesse wicked quality come stable dore shall alight cherish set vp dresse feed shall doe least thrice fourth day fifth day hauing sadled bridled girded beene accustomed shall lead place getting vp shall get vpon lead manner way sometimes trotting sometimes softly vntill begin wax hot order shall obserued euerie day yet still encreasing exercise making goe trot long vntill wearie best way make lift legges carrie himselfe handsomely rest part failing thereupon bring backe verie softly vnto stable shall walke vntill time leaue sweating shall set vp place yet later experiencest horsmen thought good walke presently set vpwalking horse good cloth well giue litter ynough found drie rubbing infallible experiment walking horse hand readiest way giue cold breed feuers humor coole suddenly vitall part leauing motion instant heart inward part receiue cold aire vnprouided vnarmed wanting assistance seruants action spirit ouercome yeeld arrest dulnesse numbnesse therefore held best walke rather house horse rubbing fretting clawing picking keepe ouerheated part warme till may coole moderate temper questionlesse safest course horse extreamly heated english hunting running horse french horse heated deliberate slower way onely warming bloud melting grease hold safest way come riding haue made horse soundly presently carrie stable taking saddle whilest one groome rubbing cha ing legges action ynough keepe cold perfect rule whilest groome rub well horse neuer take cold another groome shall take piece sword two foot length shall edge strype wype downe horse euen tip eares pitch cambrell leauing neere anie moisture amongst haires clapping clothes shall vpon set saddle girding gently take horse forth againe hand walke vp downe ayre till throughly cooled drie shall take stable set vp little pause feed conuenient watering houre dresse hath beene spoken returne former course hee shall hold course horse vntill hee see throughly woon hee shall cause shooed hindermost foot onely end may carrie rough stonie way without hurting hoofe shall vse anie thing else ride saue onely whippe trench make goe trot gallop runne flie turne leape rise also shall traine scoure ouer small hill top hill great high hill againe come downe verie softly riding place mill forge hammerworkes also beating linnens end afterward may afraid anie noise hee shall bring also place waines tumbrel carres coach charets wagon flockes sheepe swine kine goat making likewise see lamb calues beast cattell hauing throat cut shall marke thing day day till perceiue readie see certainely owne eye doth vse snuffe take smels foresaid thing shall furnish manner thing getting vpon shall guide manie place making goe step trot leape ditch riuers water notwithstanding shall faile giue kind pace going shall seeme agreeable vnto would trained vnto one manner pace courser another warre curtall anie horse neere vnto naturall dispositionto make horse trot well pace giue little tast experience shall vnderstand bring horse comely cleane loftie trot shall vse vpon newplowed land wayes deepe heauie make twitch vp legges strike cleane high find toylesome colt reason young yeares afraid extreame labour manie sorances grow thereby ride forth plaine piece ground much ouergrowne long thistle short gorsse whynnes like sharpe weed among shall ride horse good space twice thrice day thistle gorsse pricking shinnes make take vp legges roundly verie short space bring cleane easie braue trot although horse neuer trotted life find vncomelinesse trot commeth naturall carelesnesse way reason dull heauie disposition wherewith fected anie former wayes reclaimed shall night darke clouded euen thicke see hand euer darker better shall take ride newplowed field land lye high euen like vncertaine much worne wayes trot roundly swiftly rushing ouerthwart endwise sometimes sometimes another suffering take leisure regard way ow dangerous false foothold soeuer although first ikely stumble readie fall yet doe make anie care thereof bearing good stiffe hand vpon strike spurres hard de stumble encrease swiftnesse pace nely meanes whatsoeuer suffer gallop thus exercising undrie night together shall onely bring braue gal ant trot also breed great height spirit mettall also make verie hardie valiantto helpe stumbling hee subiect intollerable ice stumbling yet manner riding correction would amend ure shall vnderstand horse man fearefull vigilant way sight thereof taken pore vitall spirit awakened stirred vp preuent danger may happen vnto course else shall faile yet assured would haue horseto make horse reason manie occasion iourney bodie vnapt vnable endure hard pace trotting amble pace whatsoeuer easiest shall understand bring thereunto onely two wayes say either tra ell hand betterhood leaue consideration experience hath made triall done neither injurie vsed carefully artificially according truth rule prescribed giue little light tramell shall vnderstand called tramell horse neere forelegge neere hinderlegge two handfull aboue pasterne ioynts fastened together leather cord cannot put forward forelegge must perforce hale hinderlegge likewise farre forelegge farre hinderlegge another flat soft leather going ouer fillet horse backe fastened lynes side horse piece leather shall hold vp lynes fall tangle vnder horse foot goeth called tramelling horse shall first hand make goe softly swiftly pleasure find take way perfectly without danger falling shall take backe ride thus tramels space weeke faire plaine smooth way roade next weeke following shall ride vneuen wayes ouer layes vp hill downe hill like vncertaine place next weeke shall take tramels one side fasten backe band saddle ride day two put tramell againe take ride another day two take cleane away ride keepe pace hardly neuer forsake haue anie care speciall respect obserued tramelling horse shall first obserue leather goe horse legges soft smooth well lyned neither strait may offend maine sinewes legges slacke may fall buckle make longer shorter must verie strong also may abide twitch straines horse anie time striketh false stroake lynes passe betweene leather must good round rope made strong hemp well twound loope either end whereto fixe leather lynes must iust euen length one exceeding another strawes breadth must fixed horse legges must meanes either draw inward giue libertie stradle outward may keepe horse true iust naturall proportion horse strike short shall straiten lynes halfe inch least make ouerstrike halfe foot whole inch whole foot contrary part ouerstrike shall let forth tramell maner ooke put tramels make horse runne moneth two take vp amble perfectly beene naturall bred ambler sure likelyhood thereof pace giuen without compulsion euer rest vnchangeable making horse amble hand may done either faire descending ground vpon land either trot gallop thus hauing taken backe put either swift trot swift gallop shall chocke week mouth iert head vp aloft shuffle foot together strike confusedly thus doe oft till make strike amble shall cherish bring smooth ground helpe hand firmely aloft make continue amble anie time forsake shall forthwith toyle bring plaine ground chiefely vp hill hold pace hath gotten anie reasonable sort naturally owne seeke encrease shall apply least three foure time day one moneth doubt shall bring pe fection owne heart wish also third pace neither ambleto make horse racke called racking pace say betweene amble trot though amble haue one manner motion taking vp legges one side together yet racking moueth much shorter striking thicke yet seldome beyond step forefoot pace reputed easiest pace leaue euerie man feeling certaine manie men take much delight therein racking horse trot deepe filthie wayes able make much better riddance way whereas diuers ambling horse meanes trot lesse able driue myre doe much toyle foule dashing myring master bring horse racking pace onely best way held sore trauell much hunting running like feele yo horse begin little wearie hold vp bridle hand chocking horse week mouth make breake pace strike wearinesse ease pace bringeth quickly doe cherish nourish meanes past strength make goe faster owne inclination willing doe much hast worke onely spoyle thereof thus lesse moneths hunting riding horse shall bring verie swift readie racke horse much delight shall anie time need feare forsaking sameto make horse gallop lastly bringing horse cleane good gallop shall vnderstand two sort gallopings first stately aloft horse winding vp legges high gathering round close together loftie manner fit great horse vp seruice warres pleasure prince personage take delight stirring horse leape bound behind coruet salt like nature swift smooth long gallop wherein horse stretcheth bodie vttermost length carrying foot neere vnto ground swoopeth away swiftly nimbly easily kind gallop meet hunting horse running horse horse preferred onely labour trauell bring horse gallop aloft first kind galloping spoken shall daily vse gallop first riding newplowed land deepe yet lye flat withall shall euer obserue keepe strait hand vpon head comelinesse reyne meanes suffering gallop flower better euer anon hand rod spurre raising vp bodie making gather foot vp roundly together pride reine flownesse gallop brings gallantrie loftinesse motion kind galloping shall vse cleane contrarie course say shall traine horse vpon plainest smoothest ground find shall giue libertie reine hee may stretch forth bodie legges lay himselfe close ground like har greyhound exercise shall giue horse morning euening water wholesome aptest learne doe would haue also shall good put height speed straine coucheth bodie lesse distance euer hee taketh foot ground follow hound day twice thrice weeke giue course weeke foure fiue myles endwayes verie good way training horse swift gallop length exercise taketh fire edge horse maketh temperate sober doings whereas heat excesse courage maketh praunce doe thing rashly loftily manie obseruations rehearsed fully sufficient bring horse anie pace rider pleaseth coltsignes good colt also good horse horse stalion may iudged good great thicke boned good shape hauing small head drie nothing skinne bone small eares sharpe straight great eye standing blacke cleane verie wide nosthrils puffscompassed vp great small iawes thinne drie throat equally diuided side necke somewhat long made compassewi e thinne neere vnto head short backe broad somewhat shrinking downe like valley mane curled thicke long hanging downe vpon right side broad breast open bosled verie fleshie shoulder great straight ribbes round chine double bellie round trusted cod alike great small reines large somewhat giuing downe tailelong tufted haire thick curled legges match thicke bone thinne drie bare flesh high straight knee round small wrested inward round buttocke thicke thighes long fleshie finewie strong blacke hoofe hard high hollowed round good open rising vp toward pasternes crowne top verie small aboue cheerefull quick gentle hauing ill qualitie disease nature e verie easie tractable patiently endure anie labour also hee must mad franticke fearefull running backward hauing sciatica slacke eater scowring much vsed lye downe water riuers yet though hee haue lost eye haue beene hurt anie part bodie anie combate fight accounted worse prouided rest bodie found againe horse esteemed good stalion hath followed warres beget noble couragious colt shall fierce aduentures difficult long enterprise besides colour bay browne red dapple gray watchet mouse colour certaine note actiue couragious horse speake word goodnesse fairenesse horse ee must haue eye ioints oxe strength mule foot hoofes thighes asse throat necke wolfe tayle foxe breast haire woman boldnesse lyon sharpe quicke fight serpent pace cat lightnesse nimblenesse hare high pace deliberate trot pleasant gallop swift running bounding leape present quicke againe shall take best principallest note good horse haue ostridge feather side crestthe best marke horse excellent en rance seldome neuer tyre againe haue neere foot white behind farre foot white haue foot white behind whi e either side approued markes verie good horse prouided white vnder pasterne haue higher signe arrand lade also haue white starre forehead whi e rache face white snip nose markes good horse prouided starre artificiall rache broad enclining baldnesse raw euill signes also little foot signe swiftnesse haire signe mettall loose throppell signe much wind short wellknit vpright pasterne signe strength great endurance signes good horse none materiall none common easie perceiued carter likewise must haue knowledge age horsesto know age horse end may set worke strength best beare age horse knowne foot hoofes specially teeth horse part hath eight twentie teeth true aristotle would haue horse haue fortie beginneth haue teeth first three moneths end first yeare hath six aboue manie thirtie moneths changeth two aboue two fortie two moneths hee hath new one side touch last comming wh foure yeares old teeth called doggesteeth doe fall others come place sixt yeare great iawboneteeth vpper side doe fall sixt yeare first fallen doe grow againe seuenth yeare whole number fulfilled hollow time man certainely know old horse twelfth yeare seene extraordinar blacknesse adde much horse groweth older teeth grow longer except certaine one shorter reason eating meat shew themselues draw neerer neerer forepart iaw tenth yeare temple begin fall grow hollow sometimes eyebrowes doe waxe gray haired doth make shew sadnesse mine melancholie forehead sto peth necke heauie bodie hath eye deadly colour gray especially bay blacke roane coloured also chest nut colour colour standing vpon darke gray fleabitten groweth white white fleabitten becommeth dapplegray somewhat dark manie wrinkle plait vpper part broome brushing taile commonly counted manie yeares old wrinkle found place furthermore old horse skinne drawne p finger abideth long time young horse falleth downe also vppermost ioint setting horse taile close bodie age horse shall handle find standeth easie felt shall assured horse young bone felt sterne seemeth plaine smooth shall assured horse old aboue tenne least againe put finger horse mouth feele vpper ush inside little hole sharpe shellie shall assured young worne smooth felt horse old boue eleuen least nether ush haue ring new flesh bout may discerned flesh horse young flesh smooth plaine without difference ush blunted horse enclining old age aboue nine manie obseruations held one truly certaine alreadie rehearsed likewise charge carterto order sick horse haue especiall care health horse whose continuance terme life saith aristotle must betwixt sixteene twentie least wherefore seeth health yet notwithstanding leane shall giue parched wheat powned barly double measure shall rub verie well euerie day ouer body assuring himselfe doth profit often handed rubbed giue great deale meatdifficultie vrine likewise say hand feedeth horse meat cannot stale knowne swelling bladder yard shall make drinke pottage made pint wine stamped garlicke tenne white egges else iuice red colewort mixed white wine meane time hee must take away oates barly altogether feed nothing owne accustomed fodder grasse meat see recouer time yeare good also put within sheath yard collirie honey boyled salt else gnat line flie quicke flea prettie little piece frankincense also lay vnto reines flankes oyle mixed wine else annoynt yard wormewood stamped boyled vineger moreouer squirt syring full coole water codsthe scalding vrine medicine good vrine hath scalded priuie part haue great heat vrine cruell paine headpaine head rage horse cured often vse smallage much branne shall haue chopped leaues lettuce barly straw newly gathered let bloud vpon place braine lyeth vpon temple vpon place let stand verie darke stabl one standeth low shall know hee haue paine head distilling dropping downe water eareswill withered hanging necke head heauie hanging downe ouercooled horse cured giuing drinke swine bloud hot winethe horse cold masticke rue boyled honey little common oyle pepper disease commeth vnto sweating hot set cold place thereupon draweth vp sinewes hardeneth hide must set verie hot place couering verie warme couerings downe ground putting vnder bellie seuen eight great thicke stone red hot shall quench casting warme water vpon little little oft meanes heat may make sweat naile eye shall lifted vp little small needle iuoriethe naile eye cut quite away sc ar else make powder greene lizard arsenicke put eye fret away naile suffusion singular remedieagainst bloud pearl spot eyesalue made iuice ground iuie stampt woodden mortar else iuice berry iu e running along vpon ground leaues great clarie beaten stamped mortar wine haue let horse bloud vpon veine eye hath suffusion continue remedie manie day euening morning else blow eye pipe quill bone cuttle powned small seed rocket whole else seed hearbe called tota bona let alone till vertue haue cleansed taken away spot powder yolke egge salt burnt together put eye powder salarmoniake myrrhe saffron shauings cuttle bone strucken eye cured applying vnto cataplasme made bread steept coole waterthe bread tosted steept white wine doe good must open head veine bleared eye cured eyesalue made frankineensethe bleared eye myrrhe starch fine honie also frontlet made frankincense mastick finely powdred nd brayed vvith vvhites egges applied brow suffered lye ntill eye cease shed teares raise frontale vvith annointing dges thereof vvith oyle warme water beaten together scarres eye healed rubbing vvith owne fasting pittle saltthe skarre eye vvith powder cuttlebone mingled vvith burnt salt seed vvild parsnep pouned pressed linnen cloth vpon eye scarres paine eye cured annointing vvith juice plantaine vvith honiepaine eye enceur doth bring present death vnto horsesthe ar fore swelling kernel hart vvherefore must soone euer see brest kernell swolne plucke away immediatly without staying thus pulling away veine burst must tie end silke threed looke much kernell shall grow greater much greater impostumation would make onely therewithall ause death horse hauing drunke muchthe auiues watered verie quickly heat trauaile vpon growing cold vvalked doth beget auiues doe little differ disease called kingseuill well beast man kingseuill commeth much cooling water throat hauing beene heated vvhereupon horse looseth appetite eat rest likewise eares become cold must presently prouide helpe taking away auiues manner bend downe eare betwixt necke chyne make incision knife purpose along vpon hard fleshinesse one would say nothing verie whitesinew plucke away white carnositie fleshie substance lay place well within without linnen cloth dipt white egge couer horse vvith good couering vvalke long vntill eares become warme giuing drinke made water salt meale first causing eat little good hay let rest three day stable eat drinke else make hot fomentation thing proper case applied vnto part remoue humour afterward applie cataplasme made barley meale three ounce rosin boyled due sort good strong red wine matter shall gathered readie suppuration giue gash knife let suppurated ripe matter afterward put hollow place tent wet water oyle salt bolster layd vpon dipt disease craueth speedie remedie stay till auiues gotten vp higher past hope curing squinanci squinancie inflamation throte otherwise called disease throat swelling tongue requireth first horse let bloud vpon veine vnder tongue palate mouth fomentation whole mouth tongue warme water liniment gall oxe tartar beaten together strong vinegar concerning drinke must take oyle two pound old wine pottle amongst shall mix nine fat figges nine leekes head temper well together afterward make decoction end whereof strained shall adde salt nitre well pouned much shall see necessarie well strained shall make drinke shall cause take horne twice day morning euening quarter pint time meat cause eat greene barley fetchets meale barley amongst shall mingle nitre strangles horse glandulesthe strangles vvhich happen vnder throat fall downe braine much cooled oftentimes cured pricking vnder throat morning afterward couer head vvith kind linnen cloth rubbe throat oftentimes fresh butter especially place disease barbes hindering horse eatingthe barbes reason swolne healed making eat pea beanes stalkes pea bruising breaking causeth swelling go barbes doe grow againe must cut verie likewise verie hot thus taken hollow mouth rest taken away burning must cut away sheares euen quicke excrescence flesh growing vnder horse bodiethe soupe excrescenc vnder bellie must place make incision knife fit purpose afterwards noint morning euening ointment called dialthoea fly kept away horse ore pitch oyleto chase away file grease mingled powred vpon strawing fetch flower vpon againe disease gum teeth happeneth oftentimes vnto colt growing teeththe paine gum teeth temper fuller earth best come remes verie strong vinegar therewith rubbe jawes outside great deale place paine swelled gum short winded horsethe short winded horse cannot easily draw breath hath flankes beating incessantly notwithstanding haled whipped stirre pant verie much blow exceedingly eating meat cannot abstaine coughing horse wil euer cured true disease new caused dust windes fo stie hay hauing eaten kind dung prouender medie may draw bloud vpon greene withie hot vpon breast backe said bloud mingled wine oyle hauing done space fiue day next fiue day following make take downe lee nosthrils wherein mixt portion oyle giue drinke mustardseed well fried quicke brimstone graines paradise alike much make powder make thereof decocti honie water else composition good thicke whereof shall giue euerie morning bignesse bigge wallnut sage thicke red wine good noble else make drinke cloues ginger cummine fennellseed root galanga much one powdred mingle therewith egges little make horse take downe vvith wine holding head high end may swallow easily suffering hold downe good halfe houre end drinke may passe bowells drinke shall giue fresh grasse leaues rose vvillow temper heat said drinke horse must haue eaten thing space one halfe day taking neither yet must eat thing like space taking let vvalke lead gently headstall else getting vpon let pace verie softly may cast vp againe thus much cure vinded horse disease growne old notwithstanding yet may relieue time feare little vpon side end heat may cause cease great panting vvhich doth paine flankes vvithall slit nosthrils may attract aire breath easily let goe besides vvaies vvould also giue eat grape oftentimes drinke sweet another singular remedie consisteth giuing drinke vvith agaricke fenugreeke tempered vvith red wine else cause swallow bloud little dogge vvhich yet aboue ten day old take root gentian vvild cucumers bitter almond poune vvith honie water make drinke thereof else giue oftentimes eat siluer grasse cough hath many causesthe cough notwithstanding vvhich commeth lung part adjoyning else inward noble principall haue accordingly notable office bodie hath soueraigne remedie slitting beast hrils beast doe amend cause take downe ood pinte drinke following horne take fenugreeke linseed ch quarter pecke gumtragacanth olibanum myrrhe ounce ugar oatmeale great vvild tare ounce vvell pou ed let run bagge shall cause infused whole night hot vvater day following shall giue beast hath beene sayd nd shall continued adding thereto bowle oyle rose euen end cure cause fiue egges layed steepe one whole night strong vinegar next morning see shell become verie ten er soft giue horse take downe furthermore must ne er draw bloud horse palce soeuer shall good iue vnto continue gumtragacanth sweet oyle ague horse cured let bloud vpon veinethe horse ague vvhich found middest thigh quantitie sixe ounce place vvhich somewhat fundament neither two place vvhere annot found must take necke veine toward vvindpipe per eiue need drinke shall straine handfull purslane ingle juice vvith gum tragacanth fine frankincense prouence ro shall make take vvith honied vvater prettie small quanti ie knowne amongst markes hath ague haue stopping vrine eares become cold withering hanging downe faintnesse heartthe faintnesse heart good keepe horse verie hot giue drinke myrrhe two ounce gumtragacanth foure ounce safron foure dram mehlot powder ounce mercurie pound fine frankincense much shall sufficient proportionable mixt together made powder shall reserued vse shall giuing two good spoonfulls thereof one pinte water two spoonefulls home two bowles oyle rose drinke vvill serue many day euen till horse doe find himselfe betterthe broken backe know drinke good haue acke loynes broken member verie stiffe horse ouerheatedthe horse ouerheated shall cause swallow horne winter three ounce oyle vvith one pinte red vvine sommer two ounce oyle onely vvith like quantitie wine aboue named paine belliepaine belli vvhich call birth shall take seed vvild rue garden rue shall poune well vvith hot vvine shall make drinke vnto drinke may adde cummine fennelseed like quantitie keepe hot close vvell couered place giue drinke must get vpon backe vvalke long time rather high place low plaine field comming homeward season cold shall cloath vvith good vvoollen cloth rubbing flankes vvith oyle vntill time become cold doe breake wind vvould good also conuey fundament hollow joynt reed rose tree sufficient thicke halfe foot long annointed vvith common oyle let hollow reed sort fastened vnto taile may meanes come forth done get vpon horse vvalke howsoeuer thing goe must let haue meat hot qualitie drinke vvater boyled cummine fennellseed equall quantitie mingling vvith wheat meale keeping verie vvarme rest figge may euen cleft wennethe wenne open shall perceiue full matter make plaister gooleturdes wine salt vinegar lay vnto beware case bottome strange thing galling backe new donefor galled backe otherwise farcie horse hard cure euer must take root common cotton thistle broad white leaued thistle make eat shiues oat heale without faile lesse fifteene day three weekes continually giuen eat remedie verie easie seeing horse willingly eat cleft happen betwixt joynt legge hoofeclefts shaue away haire wash place vvine annoint vvith ointment made soot v degrease honie pouned boyled together together else flux come taking cold giue dipt sweet red vvine rosewater rub reines bellie vvine oyle rose little salt flux bloud passing vrineflux bloud must let bloud veine breast afterward make cod must long reaching betwixt foreleg doe come vp high rider may hold hand may pull hard whe horse offer goe backward gelding must bumbast buttock good long sticke taken hot fire burnt end make goe likewise vse course rearing rect make leaue horse time vvith eating hay doe eat venimous beastpoyson eaten sc pion spider venimous flie called buprestis must couered till hast let bloud roofe mouth shrew biting horsethe biting shrew maketh oftentimes dye haue oftentimes seene horse ox beast bigge colour ill vvith long snout short tayle fasteneth vpon infecteth chiefly cod maketh foure small vvounds heal venimous biting must cause presently take downe ose leaues stamped powdred vvater applie vnto place ummin garleeke stamped together case vlcer must ment place brine decoction mirtletree scatter nd sprinkle thereupon powder burned barley pomegranat rinde ooke chapter oxkeeper biting madde dogge hath singular remediethe biting mad dogge vsed day flower medicke fodder burned mixed old made fatthe leane horse giue eat fasels long pea boy ed vvater mixt amongst prouender weake hat could swallow downe must strengthen get cou age againe making sup eggeyolkes sugar verie good quantitie warme vvater mixt salt meale millet giuen horse doth greatly fat also panicke rice millet boyled mixt beanemeale salt excellent good would giuen foure time day much time least horse cast vp againe commeth passe sometimes mare troubled kind ragethe raging loue mare say vvhen see owne picture vvater taken loue hereupon forget eat drinke drie vp heat signe desiring horse signes madnesse manifested running thr gh pasture spurred oftentimes looking round sought desired something cured madnesse brought vnto water see shadow ill fauoured forget first shape beheld horse troubled yellowesyellowes shall first let bloud necke veine roofe mouth take quart ale handfull celandine fine spoonefuls honey three ounce cummin seed beaten pouder little saffron handfull tyme boile together straine giue horse drinke luke warme horse troubled staggersstagger shall first let bloud necke veine take great store bloud take veri ice bay salt beaten together good prettie quantitie assafetida dip flax hurds therein stop hard horse eares bind vp medicine may meanes fall doe thus diuers day together need require let bloud againe second day side necke let stand warme lye soft meanes drinke anie cold water gargyll pestilence amongst horsespestilence take hennes dung mix verie well old vrine boyle together luke warme giue horse pint little drinke two three morning together said let stand warme lye soft meanes drinke anie cold water horse troubled cordscords take corued made browantler old stagges horne thrust vnder cord twynd tenne twelue time till horse constrained lift vp foot cut cord asunder put little salt wound wash beefebroth cure effected horse troubled rhewme descending downe eyesrheume eye shall take bolearmoniake terra sigillata sanguis draconis like quantitie scrape adde white egge vineger much serue moist spread vpon piece leather plasterwise lay temple horse head three foure day together drie vp rheume vvartea warte naughtie substance shall grow vvithin horse shall take burnt allome vvhite copperas grind verie fine powder vvith goose swan quill blow po der horse eye vvill soone eat away excression clense eye make faire perfect straine vvhatsoeuera straine vvhether sinew bone shall bolearmoniack vinegar vvhites egges beaneflower mix together till come good thicke salue spread vpon cloth lay exceeding hot straine renewing fiue twentie houres cure horse troubled vvith spauensspauen shall take good quantitie linseed bruise vvell morter mixe verie vvell vvith cow dung put fryingpan boyle vvell therein vpon quicke fire hot applie spauen forgetting renew euerie day till brought spauen head breake like ordinarie impostumation hauing run two three day shall lay plaister pitch vpon heale vp sore case vlcers much know medicine disease little purposeto know disease signes except man know disease vvill briefe manner shew signes generall hidden infirmity horse therefore first begin vvith outward part may know griefe vvhen time horse halteth shall note obseruations following first toe ground certaine greiefe hoofe vvhen halteth bend pasterne vvell assured griefe lyeth joynt halt vvhen turne goeth right forward forbeareth foot turning going griefe questionlesse shoulder thigh vvhen standeth still setteth one foot good deale forward griefe shoulder vpper part also knee knuckle elbow goe bowing ground tread step verie thicke griefe brest halt behind gate set toe ground griefe foot sti le refuse touch ground griefe buttocke know whereof griefes doe proceed shall vnderstand griefe proceed hot cause halteth trauelleth chafed go worse worse go proceed cold cause halteth rest stand still first going journey little chafing goeth vpright againe horse halt secret halfe vnperce able insomuch incertaine vvhether halteth yea shall suffer runne vttermost length halter vvithout stay ease hand without doubt haue hidden maladie griefe whatsoeuer easily discouer thus much signes griefes outward partssignes inward griefes signes griefes inward part shall obserue horse slower labour duller spurre shorter breathed eares hang downe wont haire stare flanke hollow burne glow betwixt eares refuse meat mouth drie clammie trauell generall signes inward sicknesse horse hold head downe manger heauie dimme sighted signe feauer headach hear ach foundring bodie stagger horse turne head backe looke bodie place grieued signe obstruction liuer especially looketh right side looke bellie signe wormes colicke thin vvater runneth mouth signe stagger vvet cough tinking breath foule mattar nose signe vlcer nose mattar white glaunders blacke mourning yne yellow consumption liuer cast little lumpes mouth sheweth rotten lung horse bodie breath withall loath meat signe feuer surfet stomacke drie moist yellowes palpable swelling side forehead shew stagger betweene eares polleuill vnder eares v e mouth flapps lampas vnder throat glaunders tongue strangles left side spleene bellie legges dropsie flanke collicke cough offer cough shewes cold feather like thing wezand stagger goe reeling sheweth stagger yet staggering behind onely shewes foundring bodie paine kidneyes trembling shaking shewes feuer undring bodie hollownesse backe shewes drie maladie ropsie staling paine shewes stone leanenesse gauntnesse shewes idebound wormes consumption loosenesse bodie shewes unflamed uer costiuenesse yellowes sicknesse spleene horse dung uch stinking shewes hot liuer smelling cold liuer hardly disg sted consumption drie maladie desire lye downe right side shewes liuer left disease spleene oft vp downe bot ormes spread himselfe lye shewes dropsie groane hen downe shewes sicke spleene able rise downe ewe feeblenesse foundring bodie legges else death troubled ith wind shewes collicke desire eat thirstie shewes cold iuer desire drinke feuer ouertrauelling greedie eating nd drinkingthe horseleacherie p vegetius translated author shewes rotten lung discourse ample treatise disease curing horse looked workes p vegetius oncerning curing disease horse haue translated ra paraphrastically runned ouer french latine looke also chapter oxekeeper aboue handled chap xxix asse notwithstanding asse base contemptible thing yet verie necessarie euerie countrey house trauelleth doth necessarie worke better greater corpulent turne mill grind corne beare corne mill diuers implement commodity butter cheese nd creame sold market bring anie thing backe gaine home vpon backe toile earth light strong stiffe draw cart heauie ladenthe milke asse good consumption make faire countenance woman besides commoditie milke shee asse soueraigne remedie well consumption weake impoisoned rheumatike like disease also make nea white make tender smooth face woman wee read poppea wife nero vsing bathe keepe hew colour faire nd flesh smooth white let pa e say nothing flesh asse while young verie delicate full pleasant ta sauour eating cause hath sometimes beene great request rome also n time great estimation great noble worthie man france caused flocke ass kept carefully looked vnto like manner say nothing hide whereof made verie good sieues riddle corne also tabers daunce drum warres wherefore good housholder must appoint also one order gouerne vvho notwithstanding shall much busied taking charge looking seeing verie easie light keepe contented vvith little meat sort euen one vvill giue feed leaues thornes thistle doe fat chaffe straw commonly found almost country true must let feed vpon haue giuen eate hemlocke casteth sound sleepe seemeth much like blocke rather starke dead giue bread millet pleaseth vvell great banket looketh worse vvhen ill handled curried vvho hath charge doth easily endure stroke hunger easily tainted disease notwithstanding assekeeper shall haue care sheasse may couered time say mid march vntill iune end foaling end yeare may happen spring new grasse age asse couered must three yeares ten time must giue leaue sheasse run regard good store fruit hath brought forthrest maketh asse alwaies vnfit labour contrarie suffer male continue labour see ng much respeit vvill bring habite slothfulnesse shall suffer young asse sucke damme vntill two yeares old else shall let mare somewhat better shall set young asse labour three yeares old vvhich time vvherein must accustome beare burthensthe mark good asse draw plough serue ride vpon asse aboue ten yeres old younger three vvhich great vvell squared part hauing sufficient grosse eye vvide nosthrills long necke broad breast high shoulder great backe large chyne crest great cod flat crupper short taile hi haire drawing toward colour blacke sleeke listed hauing blacke marke forehead along bodie shall well accounted contrarie account made haue ashie coloured haire somewhat gray countrie least small aturethe disease asse short shall carefull heale sicke although hath beene said beast verie subiect disease vsing remedy doth vnto horse housholder good husbandthe asseshide shall keepe hide asse dresse make shooes vvell himselfe familie much shoo made ass skin vpon backe part whereon asse doth carrie buthens durable one shall scarce see end though vveare amongst stone grauell thornes like place notwithstanding vvith lasting grow hard cannot worne hoofe asse burnt made powder doth heale fallingsicknesse vvild asse hanged neckethe ass oo e set ring sort th may touch flesh singular good said disease also swimming head commeth weakenesse braine thinke vvild asse vvhich called ellend much seene polonia litas n su cia ellend hath are like vnto ass french men haue trauelled polonia say ellend doth resemble asse nothing eares otherwise point almost like hart hauing clouen foot great deale bigger ho e like vnto fallowdeere although asse mocked long earesthe e doth yet notwithstanding eares great soeuer doe serue shew vertue make appeare vnderstanding certaine knowledge hath change weather seeing turne raine laieth vpon necke one would say glued chap xxx mulekeeper good householder must vnfurnished thing necessarie house whether serue food sustenance ease wherefore although respect manner worke may content want mule hauing benefit horse carrie market lace whither businesse shall call yet notwithstanding mule necessa ie asement whether would rather ride vpon mule vpon horse easier pacing reason age want health odie cannot endure trauell horse constrained prouide horselitter carrie inthe mule auernia say place auernia hat scarcitie small number horse ox mule esteemed great value vsed toile earth trauaile doe necessarie hings tending commoditie maintenance house say nothing hat mule proper beast strong able carrie great heauie burthen trunkes sackes corne meale burthen horse could ot beare ordering charge mule like vnto horse well respect meat pasture feeding furniture curing disease whereunto subiect therefore wee knit vp ewer word may said cause rehearsed also willingly leaue whole knowledge feeding handling auernia amongst high request notwithstanding speake summarily mulekeeper must onely carefull wellfeeding mule also making profit profit may raised consisteth verie commodity may raised asse principally goodly herd flock hence shall chuse good goodly beautifull male mule asse horse likewise female mare asse saddle happen fit turne well conditioned yet doth cannot valiant couragiousthe diuers maners engendring male female mule although male female mule engendred either male asse mare horse female asse yet best come asse mare come horse asse though name according fire yet resemble condition dammes altogether wherefore best end may haue goodly beautifull mulesthe markes good asse c uer mule make stalion asse faire beautifull good race hath beene well tried must chuse one three yeares old vpward great corpulent strong neck strong large ribbes open musculous fleshie breast fleshie thighes welltrus ed legges blacke colour leabitten red tending bright gray siluer colour darke murrey colour commonly ass mouse colour haire liuely stirring come forth either male female mule wearing liuerie good sutable mare must lesse tenne yeares old great faire good limbes end may take keepe nature asse disagreeing bodie another kind selfe bestow vpon fruit onely gift bodie also spirit liuelinesse young stayeth dammes bodie twelue moneths wherefore mare would couered mid march vnto mid iune end may foale grasse full force thereby sure get good store milke hauing brought forth young one must vsed manner young colt excepted onely hath sucked sixe moneths damme giue sucke longer reason ach teat must made sucke mare may grow lu ie must let goe damme may learne eat still coldnesse cold hearbes chap xxiiii garlicke garlickegarlicke well knowne vnto inhabitant gascoine aquitaine limosin burdeaux would planted time onion new moone may great must set whole head little loues part may diuided taken head shall set along vpon bed diuided ridge like vnto ridged ground countrey beau end water may destroy winter hearbe desireth drie ground little moist verie white much dunged verie fat shall haue put forth three leaues must weed oft become fairer seed greater desirous haue great headed must take away top else tread downe foot put forth stalke meanes iuice returne head groweth likewise seed slowly hath better head first yeare leeke second yeare beginneth better headed like selfe perfect absolute vntill third yeare sow wane moone take vp like manner moone vnder earthsweet garli shall haue garlicke smell strong contrariwise sow new growth moone likewise haue sweet sauour sow set middest thereof kernel oliues likewise planting set side thereof cloue ioyned verie close thereunto retaine smell taste thereof like manner better taste steepe good sweet wine day sow steepe milke two dayes sowe become greater better fit conuenient time gather take vphow keepe garlick wane moone drie faire weather stalke longer stand vpright kept well vpon straw lying bare hung vp smoake chimney steept little salt water keepe long must let ripe well gathered lay sunne may drie throughly afterward lay vp place moist whereas notwithstanding sunne commeth would continue true meane sow set afterward must hang vp smoak steepe salt water kind keeping doth make barren fit whit watering must continued verie drie ground though haue remoued melon till fruit become bignesse orange vse bed shall remoue midmay countrie danger frost fiue sixe foot one another vpon border well tilled manured time forward shall weed diligenetly weed shall lighten earth trunk root without hurt flower shall peepe must cut end armes hea end flower fruit may come forth greater store aboundance side whereupon melon lieth best seeded rising earth heauie full may make triall water seed sinke downe bottome must aboue one yeare old soone groweth sicke casteth fruit vntimely sort pompions melonsthe gathering melon must gathered morning sunne rise must gathered begin cast taile yeeld pleasant smel end must beware looke cat goe catterwauling would carrie send farre must gather little ripe hand onely without edgetoole come perfect ripenesse course cutting yron would keepe must notwitstanding care called winter pompions neuer suffered ripen vpon bed ripen must gathered hung vp vnder floore higher roome turned yellow eat furthermore may say something goodnessethe goodnesse melon must vnderstand diuers sort pompions female called pompionets long haue wrinkle standing vp high thick greater bellied haue wrinkle high stretched taile vnto eye called turquins ha e verie greene colour drawing somewhat toward blacke haue shape quince properly called melon haue fast solide flesh moist mountaines full snow doe well must sow pot earth case impaled place small exceeding little seed commeth thereof liquor thereof put hollow part teeth doth stay ach anuointed killeth wormes great toyle diligence oliuetree would sowne first day aprill well male female oyntly together least one verie neere vnto male hauing backe turned west thus ioyned neere neighbour one vnto beare better flower stalkes doth feare frost raine extraordinarie cold indeed doth craue long rested fat ground strong ground may said good plight rather indifferent light groweth better also ground haue layed fallow three foure yeares haue beene medo ground two yeares ground haue beene well tilled cleane contrarie vnto madder craueth much helpe ground oppointed wheat vine yea craueth rest soyle set one yeare one otherwise root set doe degenerate oftentimes mi rie loosing force goodnesse whereas madder doth fat gro woad doth make leane therefore must sowne leane gro euermore groweth little proueth almost nothing wo rather ground well manured sowne also renewed wi dung sowne best approued ground sow woad hath laine long swarth hath seldome beene broken vp wherein obserue ploughing vp ground must turne vp great deepe furrow laying broad flat seed may throughly well couered swatth rotting vnderneath may warme comfortable meanure make flourish increase sowne seed must diligently harrowed end may wel couered incorporate earth plane haue put forth leaues height two finger must weed digge midaprill somewhat later according time hath beene faire rainie shortly afterward must gather leaues gath red must weed digg foot said root left voyd leaues must continued uerie moneth say iune iulie august sep mber sort leaues gathered foot foot fiue time must digged earth cast oft soone gathering leaues past labour digging ordinarily seuen me gone ouer say fi e time spoken two first gathering leaues doe fall manner gathering leaues begin coloured edge middest must take plant plant hand breake manner root may seeme shew though one cut away hooke lay order shadow sunne may harme injure manner making woadto make wood vnder mill would vse llstone crusheth sap juice woad much mill made strong timber compasse large millstone hollow uided outside running circular round outside shall bound together middest drawing axelltree also outmost verdges strong place yron made broad flat reasonable rebated edge plate shall least three foot leng h answering full bredth trough mill shall run mill must horse leaues aforesaid rewed trough vnder mill shall grind small may till come one substance may easily done oft turning woad ouer ouer mill runnes one must continually doe shouell woad thus sufficiently well ground shall stay horse tak ground woad trough fill mill fresh woad againe thus till haue ground woad finished shall forthwith mould vp great round ball bigge culuerine bullet twice bigge man fist ball shall place vpon fleakes hurdle made small wand penthoused housed couered ouer keepe raine side open wise sunne wind may haue full power passe hurdle shall moun ed one aboue another many height degree woad ball shall lye thereupon without touching one another till throughly well dried later end yeare towards nouember shall breake ball put vnder mill grind taking mill shall lay great heapes coole vault kept purpose onely vpon laying together vpon heapes shall begin take heat must turned turning watered vntill sufficiently moistned much water drowneth much heat heapes doth burne thereupon pile vpon heapes high long one stirre euerie second day long till become cold yet put abroad euerie fou th sixth day throughly cooled indeed worke must verie carefully performed otherwise woad would roast selfe proue thing worth immed ordered left cold paued place vntill time selling looke much longer lyeth heapes ase much becommeth better finer coun rie men tholouse whose countrie groweth great store woad doe grind woadballs gather together great vessells full put vnder millstone waterish part make vp remaining substance like lo ues drie rot afterward laying heat sunne sommer time cast lumpes put wooll died blew blacke colour best pleaseth dyer leaues thereof made plaister doe stumes heale wound new made stay flux bloud heale wild vlcers runne ouer whole bodie also leaues woad thus ground excellent kill itch r islike either men child also excellent di called farcie cureth verie sodainely chap lvii tasell tasell called also venus bathing tubbe keepeth drop water nature thistle hot drie lower part leaues close stalkes refresh water selfe withall serueth greatly respect head vse clothworkers lay wooll new clothes much also draw forth much lyeth loose order amongst rest seruiceable vnto capmakers cap spun wouen scoured sope walkersearth scouring earth profit hearbe must make choyce good fat ground well tilled two three foure arders well harrowed best seed possibly may und verie thicke hath shot one earth beginning may make cleane weed hand iune iulie digge need end september must gather head haue flowred first yeare le rest grow gathered yeare following time shall flowre head cut plant must planted anew well tilled ground putting root hole one another one ring radish trampling ground vpon verie orderly furthermore digge begin pricke put forth branch march aprill may cut cankered vnprofitable juice earth may fed vpon onely good seruiceable whereas time flowring begin flowre high head downeward till whole head flowre fallen must cut head either euening morning halfe foot stalke thereunto furthermore must forget must set sowne furrowes water may haue orderly course fall giue continuall refreshment sow anie place reasonably watrie much moisture maketh head thereof thing importance low short lesse commodiousnesse must gather bind vp bundells drie season towards moneth october furthest earlier later end september gathering doe leaue drie place itselfe subject vnto flea louse vermine causeth small oot hold vp head fall dow others doe put ten twelue little faggot together hang standing one prettie deale shade wind moist place drie south sunne turning twice thrice hanging paires order vpon pole tasell commended point middest head thereof well dried found little worme hung necke applied vnto wrests doth heale feauer quartaine assuageth likewise great ach impostumes grow nailes applied hereunto chap lviii saffron saffron best farmer cunning ordering plant doe make verie much highly esteeme called bastard saffron common people tearmed parrotseed old writer call carthamus plant vse excepted purgeth flegmaticke humour else feed parrot daintie fine mouthed plant growne vp well husbanded ordered beareth certaine little thicke head like head garleeke middest flower one would say saffron good doth enricheth maketh fat ground groweth likewise ueth great food maintenance neither leaueth root earth gathered may put forth take acknowledgement doe harme soile wherein grew euerie way much profit tilling earbe anise fennell said good farmer make profit euerie thing say much garleeke oni raise gaine selling faires fitting season helpe himselfe thereof fill purse money ordinarie saffron seruing sauce painting making colour hing toyle profit may learned easily vnderstood inhabi nt tourain prouence portugal growes exceeding aboundantly planted like cammomile spring vpon head foure finger one another must free well battilled ground verie far verie leane open sunne must well troden downe foot shall let fall flower buddeth putteth forth must left lone nature worke time gathering must haue linnen loaths draw bell euening morning drie well hadow sunne ouer cleane linnens make cleane taking away white purge may free filth fit kept drie place well couered vessell close stopt leauing earth oni n head saffron good quantitie grape drosse thereof commeth presse put vnto shall take vp moneth march haue brought forth fruit three yeares drie sun eeping place moist may plant againe place ground well tilled hath already beene deliuered arge fiue thirtieth chapter judgement naught vse saffron much speciall venime vnto heart howsoe er true profit great therefore commodious requisite farmer would ground vnprofitable vnto see ore place afor named concerning saffron chap lix brie e short reniew concerning pulse say nothing nau two kind great round one dwell lymosin prouence long one call fraunce place like manner make mention mustardseed millet pannicke cummine neither yet great wild lupine lentil fenugreeke vvhich notwithstanding pulse eed profit commoditie houshold hauing reserued garden planted end kitchingarden content selfe place admonish good farmer bringing ground kind occupation time rest hath imployed bringing forth better corne amisse sow therein either fore ne eed pulling vp plant well thoroughly gathered carried away ground may quite rid otherwise time would nothing found amongst seed wild colewort newort noysome weed deed pulse make much good husbandrie corne good make pottage continuall request houshold house soeuer make making bread millet seene place great necessitie driueth howso er peason fiches fetch lesse request inferiour tast unto great lupine cummine fenugreeke lentills proofe hereof witnesse people aruernia lymosin sauoy dauphine whereof speake place thing whatsoeuer may superfluous referre learne whole tilling seed pulse arable ground chap lx building else least wall may vnto stead banke north wind withall may keepe hiues warmth furthermore hiues though thus defended cold building yet must turned vpon east winter rather vpon south turned get bee reckoning goe higher rate sure asinesse make profit much greater respect saying true therwise fully persuaded others opinion stolne bee thriue would haue man beleeue neuer knew profit place change pasture ayre countrey onish amase besides also carried pained hiues cannot got seeking must conuey betwixt place place way highwayes rather spring winter also verie feare shaking good take day carrie away night vpon necke rather better two men beare day time must let rest haue giuen vnto sweet liquor may haue feed vpon though kept within brought place abode must open vntill next day night end haue rested night may fitter come forth peaceably morning although yet better alter change anie thing space three day stop vp mouth thinne cloth vntill sunne haue shone euening open gathereth possible make choice would therefore must content commeth next hand yet negligent purchase get best may come take good heed mingle good bad together bad would dishonour good would great deale lesse honey bad slouthfull one mingled amongst gathering shall fashion haue found anie place great number bee doe passe commonly wood forest hearbes doe abound tree sweet smell neere vnto small riuer fountaine shall vse diligence find place rest abode may easily learne hauing beene water whether neere place whither torne afterward beginning spring must take balme thyme bruised like hearbs bee loue therewith annoint hiue throughly smell iuice thereof may stay behind shall make hiue cleane sprinkle little honey hauing thus handled shall set downe wood forest neere vnto spring full bee shall carrie home thus much gathering swarmes bee chap lxiiii manner gouerning garden bee lord farme farmer hauing prouided feeding ground hiues fit place bee also hauing bought gathered good store swarmes replenish hiues shall carefull affoord diligent attentiue kind gouernment ordering anie ouer eer gouernour cattell doth allow vnto said ca ell vnder charge cause bee discreet industrious kind liuing creature yea seeing hath kind wisdome comming neere vnto vnderstanding man therefore looketh carefull manner vsage carriage towards gouernours therefore cannot abide mocker uttish negligent cannot abide ggardly filthily entreated must therefore condition shall haue charge consider manner manner liuing accordingly frame himselfe thereunto best sort may haue king obey soueraigne thing accomplishing fulfilling whatsoeuer hee shall giue charge whether goe forth returne home stay within attend alwaies company wheresoeuer comfort anie time sicke doe keepe cannot flie negligent slouthfull euerie one readie quicke anie kind worke gather rose bring home get flo sweet smelling leaues vnto stay within hiue making honey others busie making combes building little cabbins make honey others attend matter vocation lay hand softening waxe temper well making thinne leaues thereof therewith build vp frame celles cloysters others great doe sunder grosse drossie substance make readie place honey paine diligence doe keepe cleane notwithstanding neuer defiled anie owne dung flying abroad auoid excrement flying ordi rily doe nothing keepe watch ward end vttermost power may withstand whatsoeuer thing may annoy hurt die within hiues king dead stirre place crowding one vpon anothers backe seemeth lament mourne make shew noise humming vehemently keeper doe looke vnto take vnder suffer themselues rather die hunger forsake briefe euerie one diligent worke cannot anie one companie occupied something cause driue away drone worke neither good anie thing else wast honey hate aboue thing euill sent neuer flie light vnto bloud fat content themselues leaues flower onely sweet smelling iuice take delight pleasant goodly song wh commeth passe scattered abroad called together
