gouerning chap lxv order gouerning bee yeare long whosoeuer therefore hath charge ouersight bee must carefull first pasture whereof haue made mention shall diligently looke vnto hiues twice thrice moneth beginning spring continuing till nouember time yeare wherein stand need something well ordered continue tenne yeares must opened moneth march honeycombes made cleane verie strong solide feather cannot come hand wha filth gathered time winter may cast spider spoyle combes may taken away afterward shall smoake oxe dung burnt dung certaine affinitie gratefull well liked bee meane time handle hiues shall well uised day haue deale wife haue beene drunken present come neere vnto without washed made cleane well apparrelled like manner hee must meat strong smell salt meat sowsed thing strong sent garlicke onion like thing contrariwise let carrie mouth something hath good smell meanes loue well may handle hiues pleasure little pretie bird neuer hurt annoy time much begin multiplie encrease cast swarmes soone flye desire nothing flye away abide old one much lesse become subiect vnto meet keepe watch verie diligently morning tide past till two houres noone may flye vnto place wherefore discerne spie kingskings bee good take wing make shew themselues oftentimes seeme though would flye together companie also cast dust vpon else water eanes kept going away goe owne yard limit owne kingdome neither suffer troupe goe farre else good come forth astonish occupie mind sounding basons ards broken pot ringing forth softly much much ound stronglier much mount higher ayre stray gentle low sound like manner doe stay keepe themselues neere hand proceed fasten themselues vpon next branch tree grape doe hang vpon branch must gather hand trowell basket annointed swee balme drop honey set row basket else make shorter dispatch may cut bough branch tree put verie softly bee within dressed ba hiue mouth hauing beene first sprinkled wine ter must set vpon board vpon ground end vpper part ng kept close bee may goe place open vnderneath swarme bee little bird got anie hole bole bodie tree carrie thither hiue well annointed e rie place also hole mouth verie sweet smelling hearbes draw ouer hole entrance hollownesse end may inuite delightsomenesse smell better contentment g oe abide dwell rest themselues place cannot hand one withall somewhat vn ealt take pole tye end hiue sprinkled good wine hold neere vnto clew bee thus faile goe carrie neere vnto hiues doubt goe vp themselues short time else best hee shall hold rea ie new hiue receiue hee seeth young king shall forth young traine within day two come gether mouth old stocke shew sufficient signes token desirous place owne peculiar vnto themselues doe giue one rest contented therewith abide erein knowne young hoast come abroad noise hum ing make hiue three day purpose come broad campe warlike men would rise vp remoue know hen make noise must lay euening uerie hiue ay heare noise humming make yet indeed noise humming sometimes signe token ght strife raised betwixt swarme must well pre ted otherwise ciuile warres deadly fight whole troupe companie quickly ouerthrowne brought nothing intended ombat taken vp bowle cute boyled wine vnto else honied wine liquor sweetnesse familiar bee appease furi yet perceiue ski mishes endedto kill king must make hast kill king bee cause sedition tu lts manner kill th ob erue whole commeth hiue alreadie led vpon bough tree marke whole swa e bee doe hang manner grape vpon branch signe one ki moe yet agree amongst selues shall let alone till hiues whole troupe diuided manie clewes round bunch need doubt manie king doe agree together shall ee gathered heape greatest troupe may search looke king annointing hand iuice sweet balme honey may away shall touch seeke thus amongst vntill haue ound king author must kill cast thus may di ne find king common king somewhat greater longerthe mark signes king bee legges straight high wing lesse faire colour neat smooth polished without haire sting except perhaps say certaine gro thicke haire haue vpon belly sting wherewith notwithstanding neuer sting anie harme king found blac hairie ghalliy behold worst sort king must therefore killed notwithstanding moue warre stirre vp coales amongst young swarmed brood thus see caseto maruelling behold small bird ced enraged loue towards king de end willingly cast expose liues open hazard enemy come besides incredible obey ance let continually vnto hiues shall made readie receiue new swarmes must rubbed hearbes named sprinkled drop honey cause keepe therein time spring likewise som commeth passe reason hardnesse winter past ase sicknesse great wan scarsitie bee old stock remedied putting new swarme hiue killing young subiects may content y liue peaceably vnder old haue swarme next way put troupe two three diminished stock one bedewing sprinkling liquor shut vp hiue fet something within eat vntill well wonted vnto keepe three day vp giuing onely little fresh ayre little hole come passe king old hiue shall haue le aliue doe die must chuse another king hiues nie giue gouerne case meanes doe doe faile anie purpose inclination take new swarmes must breake downe little chamber lodging king end young swarmes shall together old may betake themselues first haunt still abide continue vnd old new king captaine must necessitie dot compelled want naturall chiefe gouernours themselues ancient rainie weather continuing long bee able goe seeke pasture bring home food vnto young brood must helpe prouision honey vntill time shall abroad get owne liuing worke honeycombe otherwise shall quickly make end hath beene oftentimes seene come passe summer must gather honey whereof speake hereafter time euerie tenne day hiues must opened smoaked oxe dung afterward cooled warring emptie part hiue asting thereinto coole water likewise made cleane grub taken anie therein let rowle tumble themselues vpon flower must take anie thing may annoy become redious vnto cause flye away despaire faire day end autumne must make cleane hiues looking ho also calme time found euer combe vngathered pluck away sometime leane thinne must therefore kill bee manie doe rather saue must sprinkle brush dipt honied water milke hauing driuen together heape smoake keeping close shut vp hiue winter may open touch keepe close within till sunnebeames breake forth againe comfort well couered stopping without whatsoeuer clifts hole mortar neats ung mingled together sort nothing left open onely way passe thereat also must carefully looked vnto tha although hiues doe alreadie stand vnder couert yet couered againe stubble boughes much possibly may kept om cold wind feare abhorre anie thing must fore ee likewise neither raine snow may doe hurt make prouision store fat earth mosse wood ried together strong band end tree may hurt either wind thing downe neere vnto pole wood strengthten beare greatly blamed fault committed hauing faire wild us others fruit thereof displeasing doe cut verte low hauing faire branch aboue bodie thicknesse man legge graft fiue sixe year scarce couer wound haue made kind grafting whereas might much eale haue grafted vpon branch beene aboue finger thicke would haue growne better brought profit haue foure branch may make manie graft thereof beare fruit second yeare chap xiii grafting end branch graft end branch haue goodly new wood great siences high although tree haue beene grafted yet throughly growne take graft sort tree cut siences high part tree mind graft graft thicker siences graft manner goat foot hath beene said alreadie small plant siences bignesse graft cut old new wood little higher lower cleaue little cut graft like thicknesse sience haue cut making short incision reseruing barke vpon side looking side equall thicknesse set graft thus fitted cleft barkes side graft may stand euen barkes branch graft ynough euerie one haue one good eyelet two wreathing leaue anie longer would good must wreath wrap earth mosse couer ouer againe woollen clothes tye vnto verie strongly hath beene said also meanes may procure one tree shall bring forth diuers fruit situation countrey qualitie ayre doe refuse reiect haue seene sometimes padua garden messire gabriel one stalke tree hath borne fruit diuers sort nothing hinder let v countrey like perhaps place fauourable furtherance mildnesse ayre correspondent answerable moreouer graft little plant manner see thicknesse graft graft neere vnto earth three finger thereabouts manner grafting end branch must done tree whose branch haue beene formetly cut reason either great want else great aboundance sappe put forth stocke new shoot three foure yeares may grafted manner wee haue spoken thus columella teacheth v graft oliuetree vpon figgetree chap xiiii graft betwixt wood barke vsuall graft betwixt wood barke tree begi put vp sappe end februarie vntill april barke parteth better wood chiefely manner grafting vsed thicke plant cannot easily eleuen middest either crosse otherwise stockes branch tree haue thicke fat barke figgetrees plummetrees pearetrees chef x tree graft thus grafted must gathered kept long wee haue alreadie said least peraduenture wee meet tree late bear time haue budded may graft gathered without bud shortlegged shortstalked appletree like kind grafting plant must sawed vp high graft afterward hath alreadie beene said incision graft anie great length thicknesse barke must taken away little end fashioned manner head speare thicke one side afterward stocke must verie well cleansed take away roughnesse vneuennesse saw verie shap graft may grow close thereunto thrust sharpepointed knife scizars bone iuorie deept ynough betwixt barke wood plant much shall drawne cut fitted end graft may inter therein graft may ioyne vnto stocke shall fet therein done must couered wrapt well strong earth mosse manner may pricke manie graft stocke according thicknesse beare manner abrico grafted appletrees almondtrees peachtrees small selfe vpon sweet cherrietree rest meanes cause plum degenerate nature become bastardly well shape tast fittest time graft februarie march rather stocke barke certaine kind scab doth take hold either letting gumme stand hang wax old casteth forth else reason mo e gathereth cause would haue gumme taken away beginning cold weather mo e rubbed rough linnen cloth mo e rubber horsehaire time happeneth likewise vnto vindisposedesse fault gardinerthe plumtree frame casting ground foot cutting rotten corrupt wood whereupon turneth rowleth selfe vp small ball sometimes one place sometimes moe disease neglected doth spread selfe end ouer tree one end another bringeth wholly distruction therefore soone shall see sicke tree sort crumple runne vpon heapes must cut verie cleane boughes thus diseased whereof would murdered killed euen sound whole branch withall order husband good sort foot taking away euili humor maner crooketh causeth turne round wood happeneth also sometimesthe languishing like heat two sort one made raising vp vapour vp high alchymists call per ascensum another manner falling sweat defluxion humor descending downeward commonly called per descensum water part distilled way called per ascensum oyles part distilled per descensum say part certaine water sometimes distilled per descensum also oyles per ascensum oyles drawne leaues flower fruit seed like matter water distilled per descensum wha oyles distilled per desce sum chiefely sweet water made flower leaues good smell distilled doe euaporate spend best vapour quickly distillation thereupon retaine better sort longer time naturall smell way take new rose flower put linnen clothrosewater distilled per descensum spread stretcht ouer bason brasse earth well glased aboue bason set another vessell brasse earth manner round fryingpanne hauing bottome couered hot coales therewithall must looke let fire remaine anie long time vpon vessell feare grow hot water smell burning thus way better anie make great filtre haue declaredto distill filtre namely either separation liquor generall else separation liquor quality separating muddie earthie finer subtle part proper ordinarie way distill iuices haue thicke consistence presently vpon cooling first pressing namely iuices citron limons orange againe prudent expert apothe carie maketh sy ups iuices citron limons doth first distill straine iuices fittre goe dispense syrrups manner distill filtre haue three dish bowles basons vessel fashion matter liquor would distill doth require placed seated may either stand higher higher lower lower euerie one aboue vnder another highest containe distilled lower distilled vppermost shall one moe piece cloth felt sufficient length dipt ice must broad one end sharpe broad end shall lye iuice narrowpointed end shall hang without thinner part liquor shall rise ascend running downe drop drop vessell sort muddiest impurest part shall stay behind vessell sometimes must wring piece cloth beginneth become blacke drop distill slowly thicke matter carried along thinne hauing washed put afterward againe vessell man disposed distill one liquor manie time may place manie vessel manner stayres euerie one except lowest put filtre sort haue said last lowest must serue onely receiue rest stead piece felt apothecary vse oftentimes sleeues woollen cloth otherwise called sharpepointed hose purifie make gathered cold moist simple rather waterie ager peterlike salt liquor oylie substance wherefore better distill cold moist simple putrifactionwhich e distilled oyles resolution made worke fire make end therefore word oyles drawne thing quin ssence resolution made force fire vnctuositie radicall humour life forme giueth vnto simple whereunto bel geth otherwise naturall forme giueth vnto parti lar thing whatsoeuer wherein also lyeth principall force simple separated distillation remaineth thing substance simple distilled onely impurity chap lxxv manner furnace must made extracting chymicall oyles furnace serue distill chymicall oyles diuers fashion according vnto diuersitie well matter distilled vessel serue distill withall yet common commodious profitable fashion build vp furnace bricke tyle fat earth mortar playster alone make round shape least let within end fire carried vp high may disperse selfe ouer equall measure withall make reasonable length thickenesse three foot high bearing foot round compass euerie way within least shall bee also three seuerall space roomes whole height first one foot second foot halfe third rest furnace first roome shall grate yron lay coales vpon making fire second roome loft shall two roddes yron shall distant one foure finger whereupon shall rest earthen vessell fashion earthen pot panne forme manner wee declare vnderneath first distance also aboue grate second distance must make two opening place square hauing couers shut manner mouth ouen lower two mouthes shall emptie take ash made therein higher shall put coales kindle fire also furthermore highest part furnace likewise place may commodious must left certaine hole smoake passe see picture draught furnace distillation water sometimes need furnace omitted let passe brandrith made serue setting vpon vessell distill pot bowle panne earth yron making fire vnderneath chap lxxvi manner vessel must vsed distilling oyles certaine manie doe vse diuerse sort vessel distilling oyles leauing examination varietie propound vnto themselues entreat exactly chymicall matter intending selfe onely giue instruction vnto good huswife commaundresse countrey house set downe two sort vessel distilling oylestwo sort vessel th distilling oyles one fit verie conuenient distill hearbes flower seedes fruit rootes beast part excrement beast wood gummes gummie droppes thicke vnctuous liquor speake first let made vessell verie choice earth verie cleane verie well kneaden made vp like paine industrie potter make vp let thicknesse finger thereabout fashioned like egge yet like egge whole cut round away almost one halfe must great conta ning much greatnesse widenesse copper vessell yet notwithstanding great onely especially respect height may agree third last loft furnace widenesse euen iumpe mouth furnace wherein must stand like manner bottome must beare breadth may little flatter space betwixt two rod yron made fast set ouerthwart end second distance fu nace end may rest vpon firmely therefore doe well herein furnace would builded vessell made need great fire distill withall prouided pot place earth yron selfe haue seene apothecary second vessell shall copper la ten shaped also like vn egge gourd hauing wide mouth whereunto must fitted long stretchedout necke least foot length comming downe head necke vapour gourd shall rise vp said head vessell shall hold twelue fifteene pi t otherwise shall made greatnesse answerable vnto quantitie matter meane distill generally wee declare euerie pound matter hearbes seedes c put vessell nine tenne pound water besides must agreement betwixt greatnesse copper vessell capacitie earthen vessell standeth within furnace may free one another two three finger filling sand hereafter declare concerning height thereof together head must stand aboue earth foot halfe least third vessell shall headthe head shall round aboue sharp pointed end vapour arising may fall downe againe must set little stand tub wherein must put coole water easier thickening fixing vapour one side little tub shall spout pipe shall come head oyle shall drop downe vessell receiuing side little stand must tappe spiggot must come capacitie may emptie water holdeth become hot head shall ioyned orifice throat last aforenamed vessell meanes large wide pipe shall come dow e head set selfe mouth throat said copper vessell verie closely end vapour rising may passe ou thereby anie way better perfecting inarticulation two edge brimmes may better ioyne together sh ke may called necke bladder vapour shall rise vp head fourth vessell shall receiuing vessell shall receiue oyl distilled must glasse clearenesse cle enesse proportion shape first sort vessel distill oyles hearbes seedes flower forth doth represent bladder keepe preserue face long time continue young youthfull brightnesse freshnesse oyle veriebalme conglutinate heale wound speedily also cure inwarddisease taking two drammes thereof inward good also must make lesse account silkeworm honiebee besides pleasure may conceiue meruailous industriousnesse little beast making spinning silke may also reape incredible profit excellent worke honoureth maketh men glorious attyred pompe workmanship piece cunning skill insomuch wee see king prince gentleman prelate iustices great notable personage vsually decked apparrelled trauaile prettie creature silke serueth onely apparrelling men also singular remedie comfort heart sicke reioyce recreate heauie troubled spirit anie one wee may well vnderstand famous con ection called physitions alkermes compounded part decoction infusion silke iuice kermes taken inwardly verie soueraigne remedie faintings swownings wherefore good wise mistres e countrey fa shall make great account keeping silkewormes end shee may reape profit sale silke shee shall gather yearely profitable practise verie well knowne amongst wiues tourraine france chap lxxxvii situating place keepe silkewormes necessarie also carefull huswife vndertaking gouernment silkewormes making best commoditie thereof doe chuse conuenient place farme better ordering keeping must rather high low hauing good ayre without moistnesse prouided windowes sunne may come morning euening seeme good vnto haue charge gouerne windowes must shut close else glased paper windowes fine linnen cloth end raineth bloweth cold weather moist may cleane wall without hole cr uises neither cricket lizard rat like vermine may enter get kill spoyle little thing either night day must ouerthwart partition pillar vpon shall fastened manie boords soone spring draweth neere shall see mulberrietree beginneth bud shall make readinesse egges wormes shee hath kept winter brooded sit vpon shee see mulberrietree ow bud shee shall lay fresh dung vnto rootes thereof new moone march thereby bring forward otherwise lack theleaves mulberrietree come passe wormes hatched bred constrained food haue recourse heart thorne elme leaues tender branch nettle fourth vnto tenth day moone neuer decrease wrapping silke round w bring forth fourth ay time strong sort end huskes bee greater harder finely haired anie bred another time bred decrease moone always feeble yeeld profit meanes make breed haue watered bathed white wine rather warme water lay neere fire vntill little warmed lay betwixt two pillowes stuffed feather made likewise somewhat warme fall sleeping else would burst true breeding young must soberly dieted haue cast changed fourth time within three day eat better euer didsignes wormes would mak silk vntill time body begin shine make ght make goe labour soundly great profit husbandman office grazing properly belonging profession wherefore would make new medowesto make new medow ground make choice best ground ground shall lay sure good farmer must neglect medow ground seeing husbanding matter care paine labour first care must keepe grow thornes great high stalkes hearbes would pulled vp root autumne winter bush bramble must exceeding carefull know goodnesse badnesse fruitfull barren quicke growth slow beare one entire crop two accordingly must lay giue time rest growth thus ground verie fruitfull rich yet coldnesse clyme beare aboue one crop shall needfull lay may day reasonable fruitfulnesse may lay annuntiation ladie verie hard barren best lay candle s may haue vttermost spring summer grow also exceeding fertile warme close couched beare two croppes shall lay candlemas may cut end may midst september cut time ill husbandrie profitlesse howsoeuer men may opinioned either custome imitation neighbor yet shall find certaine hay good soeuer growth yet want sunne kindly withering neuer good either feed sustaine nature hauing iuice rotting dried within becommeth black vnpleasant unwholesome insomuch worst straw better best hay therefore let euerie husbandman haue great care good kindly withering hay esteeme euer qualitie quantitie medowes laid husbandman shall haue great care ences least either owne men cattell day night breake may doe iniurie houre doe profit moneth young tender grasse nipt bitten first springing hardly prospereth till sythe haue cut grasse stronger plant nipt bitten forthwith loose beautie flourishing groweth straight vpright low crooked illfauoredly neither fast verie slowly manie time without seed therefore meanes preuent cropping medowes cattell first saxifrage hearbe giueth perfit season albeit haue deliuered particular collection seed hearbs necessarie sowne medows yet would aduise curious bestow labour culling seed rest sow medows care respect vpon medows thick strew thicker euer better must foresee thus sow medowes cause ground bare eaten possible especially sheepe bite neerest cattell ground bestow vpon manure dung fattest fruitfullest maketh seed instantly sprout first shower shall also obserue sow medowes whether spring fall see dung cattell last grazed vpon lye upon still heapes fell body dung shall raise ground beetle made purpose beat verie small piece spread generally ouer whole medow sow seed amongst meanes seed quickly take root also another way enriching medowes especially lye high danger flouds part euer barrennest foddering feeding cattellfoddering great cattell vpon winter season thus husbandman shall barrennest part medow ground safest water flouds make vp hay large handsome stacke reeke either round square according pleasure quantitie hay stacke thus made shall fence thorne hedgeware keepe cattell tearing spoyling till time farmer himselfe shall thinke meet cut downe extremitie winter shall come either grasse cleane consumed reason long frost snowes cattell cannot come anie food time cut downe hayreekes fodder cattell therewith morning euening cutting downe time shall conueniently serue fodder cattell spoyle herein vildest husbandrie hay thus cut downe shall lay one place diuers place ground little tuft hillockes scattering armefull thereof manie place lay one place verie small circuit neere together cattell would disagree offer gore one another least stronger cattell would euer beat away weaker rob food whereas scattered diuers remote place beaten away one place goe another take food without trouble shall euer obserue lay tuft heapes hay haue cattell neither yet doe meane manner foddering shall ouerspread anie great piece ground one time according number cattell close packed together ease fodderer well husbanding hay carried vp downe would make much wast scattering lay one foddering within two three yard another sufficient speake great cattell ox kyne steeres horse like fodder sheepefoddering sheepe must lay hay long rowes one row three foure yard another vpon driest cleanest ground find trampling treading cattell else much spoyle hay herein also noted must meanes lay fodder aboue twice one place change alter ground finding still drie vntrodden place fodder well keeping ground two much foyling tearing vp foot cattell also ing hay would halfe lost layd wet myrie place thus may one winter runne ouer great piece ground onely sow plenteously hayseedes fall hay carrying also manure ground excellently drawing together beast one place making l dunging thereupon say manner enriching ground carrieth discommoditie equalleth goodnesse reaped therefore much esteemed alledging trampling cattell teareth vp greeneswarth ploweth vp ground sort hardly beare good croppe grasse yeare two answerecommoditie foddering doe happily teare vp digge ground loose next yeares croppe part yet first yeare past second double third treble anie encrease formerly receiued ground neither goodnesse euer abated besides ground subiect anie filthie soft mosse fuzzie grasse vnsauourie vnwholesome beast also choaketh deuoureth vp better herbage treading cattels foot vtterly kill make ground fruitfull euer nay ground haue beene much subiect small whynnes prickgrasse venimous weed anie ground according opinion best husband course onely destroy conclude medow well kept maintained doth alwaies bring double commoditie ill gouerned husbanded chap v harrowing watering keeping close well defensed medow ground besides seedes good hearbes verie requisite medowes yet workes needfull goodnesse hay medowes must harrowed raked presently sowne breake clod small earth dust mower may thereby hurt sythes ground medow withered drie maruellous commoditie vnto draw winter long least small brooke watering moistening seeing moisture naturall nourishment hay would done especially moneths nouember december ianuarie februarie afterward earth hath drunke fill stop way whereby water brooke runneth true medowplot lye vpon side hill vpon high ground shall need water first raine falleth descend water medowes verie sufficiently ioyned iuice goodnesse dung shall haue bestowed higher place neither shall needfull water ground much great quantitie threeleaued grasse would die againe must cause anie water ouerflow anie old medow ground time great excessiue cold except continue long time water fayling ground thus boyled againe drenched would verie much annoyed vehemence frost yce likewise anie marish dead water anie part medow must cause runne drayne conduit trench without peraduenture superaboundance water doth much harme want scarcitie lacke must sure also keepe swine medowes alwaies turning ouer snout aying great soddes earth neither must admit anie great cattell saue verie drie hornie hoofe doth sinke earth either breake grasse cut sunder rootes whereupon cannot spring multiplie anie chap vi mowe meadowes againe againe gather hay refresh meadowes bring barren meadowes tillage mowing meadowesmowing meadowes must according growth ripenesse ripen soone late sure cannot fall husbandman greater losse cut meadow ripe sap moisture come fully roote grasse vvithering shrinketh away fall nothing soft fuzzie vnwholesome substance cattell eat also let stand till ripe haue shed seed ill husbandrie vvill juice much dried stalke substance giue nourishment cattell lost therefore know grasse truely fit cut shall looke carefully vpon vvhen see top thereof looke browne cocke head bell bottells beare seed stand vpright looke direct heauens bend head downeward looking backe earth may certainely assured fit good time cut earth hath giuen due ought haue fertile verie rich soyle may cut twice yeare beginning iune vveeke midsommer reasonable ground hath title good earth onely translation thomas third iuliebest time cut grasse ground extreame cold moist barren vvill lammasse sometimes middest september generall cutting mowing haye would euer done new moone time vveather conjecstures cleare constant likely continue faire soone haye mowne plentie grasse see lye thicke swathe ayre sunne cannot passe freely shall cause certaine forkes follow ythes mow cast abroad thin whereby sunne may vvither called tedding hay next day dew taken ground shall turne let vvither side handling finding feeling fully drie next day shall orkes rake draw together great quantitie long row row must draw way wind blowes least drawing contrarie way vvind scatter abroad loose labour profit rowes called windrowes soone thus gathered together shall forthwith thrust haye close vp together make windroweswindrowes good bigge handsome cockes sharpe top broad bottome six seuen may make waineload howsoeuer sloth weakenesse may say little cockes aske little labour best yet certaine great cockes much bettergreat haycockes keepe haye safer vvet shal fall also make sweat haye great deale kindly cockes shal let haye stand day least amisse breake open againe let ley sunne till haue dried vp sweat moisture vvhich done shall load according maner soyle wherein liue carrie barne elswhere according pleasure manner making haye must vnderstand fine cleane purest grasse without vveeds stumpes thicke leaues grosse substance find grasse rough nature part vvoodlandgrasse much intermixt burnet penygrasse thicke leafed weed shall giue double withering haue mowed tedded shall turne twice thrice ere cocke put drie cocke shall breake open morning make vp drie cocke againe night three foure day together load sure cocke take verie good sweat carrie home stacke vp shall please best ground extreame barren cold moist full verie sowre stubborne grasse also little plentie thin short hard cutting shall need ted hay steed labour shall mowne forke make thicke little grassecockes bigge prettie little moalehills reason whereof sowre harsh grassesowre harshgrasse exceeding slow growth must necessarilie verie late yeare ripe readie cut whereby wanting kindlie heat strength sunne cannot great difficultie vvither vvell vvherefore must adde vnto art may bring good haye casting little heapes cockes doe grasse layed together heat selfe often turned tost ayre may goe drie made cockes againe euerie day bigger bigger vvill end owne heat come kindly hay full benefit sunne herein shall obserue first make small cockes second day shall make bigger putting two three cockes one next day shall put two three bigger cockes one euerie day increasing bignesse cockes find vvither till bring great cockes three foure make waineload estate shall let stand foure fiue day load vvhilest little cockes shall breake open twice day least according fairenesse vveather must vnderstand whilest grasse vnwithered cockes let lie long grasse turne yellow begin putrifie vvhich often stirring vvill preuent lastly touching making hay must vnderstand greatest enemie hath wet raine therefore must carefull make vp driest fairest weather raine shall happen fall turne till vpper side drie turne wet grasse wet earth readie way make rot speake little touching choyce vse hayechoyce vse haye shall vnderstand haye long loggia greatest burthen best horse verie drie sweet got good season vvhich verie long growth verie pleasant cleane grasse without weed hard stumpes prick like best milchkine stallfedoxen onely preserue kine would got verie drie haue sweetnesse pleasantnesse may keepe feedingcattell would altogether throughly vvithered got little greenish may take heat mowe may onely discolour turne red bring thirst vnto cattell make drinke vvell grasier opinion cattell neuer feed well till drinke well haye finest shortest growing vpon high drie ground full flower sweet best sheepe young calues must got verie drie neere vtterly without raine drie hardly lye vpon waine best husbandman saith moist haye profitable increase milke doth meane shall get haye greene part vnwithered brings rottennesse ouerdrinesse verie ill milke shall get barne drie without scorching scalding vnnaturall extremity hay taking kindly sweat mowe called moisthaymoisthay taketh little much heat mowe altereth colour driehaydriehay keepeth fat cattell griping painefull griefes belly euermore verie much subject vse husbandman well france country haue brought haye drie cocke put great stoukes pettie stackes without doores let remaine fortnight may take full sweat brought barne hayloft needlesse double labour may verie well spared order obserued prescribed much curiositiecuriositie spring fearefulnesse ouerheating mowburning preuent ancient spared labour nay curious first time would suffer haye meanes lye neere sinke smell beasthouse vvhere noysome sauours supposing haye would naturally owne inclination draw corruption vnto feare might haue verie vvell beene spared touching later crop haye euer ne moneth september shall respect vse like hay barren ground last written yere time much shot haue kindly withering neither vsed feeding fat cattell milch kine onely drie beast onely labor oxe horse mule asse gathering hay perceiue meadowes become barren vvhether happen negligence hauing beene carefull ynough husbanding reason age seeing earth sometime rest selfe vvearie recouering strength againe onely seene barren soyles truely fertile good ground neuer wearie bearing especially lie low gentlie washt water lie high violently heat sun many time decay aboundance shall time perceiue shall good forbeare cutting next yeare onely graze cattellgrazing cattell especially sheepe vvill good manuring vnto make beare grasse good plentie euer afore often cutting occasioneth barrennesse often feeding breedes increase naturall fertilitie hardnesse ground waxeth barren shall vse like meanes vvould making new meadow set downe second chapter booke else see loose labour renewing barren meadow set downe selfe reduce arable ground especially drie parched bringing forth verie small store grasse growne ouer hard st fraught rather naughtie weed good profitable grasse whereof must cut vpper face crust earth aprill shallow delfe turfes fadome halfe long halfe broad thicknesse two finger drie turfes sunne concocted heat sunne fit one another lay one vpon another manner furnace afterward set fire good store straw burned let coole sixe seuen day spead ash thereof equally ouer field looke good raine may incorporate ashie earth accordingly performed plow vp iune presently sow vvith millet afterward rie end mastling wheat chap vii ozierplot remember three thing carefully kept increased diligence vvorkeman doe make rich vvithout great trauell say meadowgrounds ozierplot willowplot vvhich meanes vvater lightly slyding veines earth fat vvell liking place vpon side hill vvatering manifold streames round doe naturally grow eu rie yeare yeeld great profit vnto maister feeding hi cattell making hoopes vessell binding also fewell benefit pole woodden vessells arbour stake hedge supporter vine therefore speake first ordering husbanding ozierplot willowplot vvhich vve dreame haue assigned place meadow far remoued arable ground much shadow hurtfull wheat line pulse graine neuer grow vvell ouershadowed contrarie meadow ground receiue great profit thereby well grasse doth grow fairer pleasantly shadow vvhere shadowed also leaues ozier willow aller tree falling vpon meadowes rotting maketh fat abounding grasse fertile ozier old writer call seawillow wickertree say apt bend desireth come verie neere water loueth rather stand vpon descending side valley ozierplot would end side willowplot ozierplot must prickt line prettie small ditch drawne betwixt two line euerie slip must set one another fiue foore halfe giue spreading vvill abide shadow tree loueth much haue fruition southsunne tame red ozier requireth great husbanding afraid frost showres raine fall march verie cold vvater vvhite greene ozier vvhich neither bend yet defend themselues well harder nature grow higher vvill good pricke downe moe tame one alwaies set shadow must grow kind ground vvhich shall digge cast breaking clod afterward verie small much shall make earth dust spring shall harrow lay euen afterward shall sow verie thicke vvith seed elmes vvhich shall time become little red hauing beene long time sunne yet notwithstanding retayning naturall substance moisture shall sow thicke earth shall couered vvith cast fine mould vpon good two finger thicke vvater little couer earth vvith straw broken boughes braunches end vvhat shall come earth may deuoured bird vvhen siences shall begin shew take away straw boughes pull vp bad vveeds verie carefully vvith hand sort small rootes elmes vvhich yet tender pluckt vp therewithall way square must discreetly cast weed may easily reach middest euerie vvay f r vvere broad constrained pulling vp vveeds tread deale better autumne spring time three yeares passed must transplanted autumne vvhen earth beginneth moist vntill beginning spring time roote may drawne without leauing barke behind may plant elme prouision chiefe lord auaileable profit may come thereof good householder shall esteeme little fish seeing may make prouision table great gaine vnto purse rather shall prouide place neere vnto house cast pooles stewes end need may find victual therein himselfe familie readie alreadie kitchin besides may yearely sell store make money purse therefore appointing ground poolesthe situation pooles stewes breed feed fish shall chuse ioyning vnto medowes leane place could otherwise make profit yet must firme ground grauellie sandie place doe feed fish excellent well notwithstanding muddie dyrtie poole best tench burbet cod e le slipperie slimie fish loueth health must furnish pooles stewes manner fish poole shall maruellously well seated commodiousnesse place affoord continuall refreshment flowing fountaine brooke little riuer falling whereby continually first water may remoued new supplyed place thereof suffering stand long impounded therefore possible poole haue conuenient issue one part meanes water renewed easily fish therein made chearefull better thri ing euerie body ight whereas contrarie standing corrupted water affoordeth nothing bad nourishment making slesh thereof ill tast vnpleasant eating meane time must orget set grate brasse yron close fastened pierced small hole conduit water may find one passage another yet stay fish getting forth good poole large great end shall twist haires neither hard soft hold mediocritie may twine couch close together end shall fasten together vvith fishersknot vvhich ordinarie fast knot foulded foure fiue time abou vnder aboue according season yeare shadow vvhich daungerous least scarre fish soonest ice bite colour watergreen best yellow next russet darke browne tawnie die line watergreeneto fishing line shall take pottle haires corke ynch little long bigger line bigger cork corke shall thrust quill quill line corke serueth onely let know fish biteth therefore lesse better onely giues lesse shadow prouided euer eye though angler fish without corkes yet good certaine placing corke vpon line must put small end downeward bigge end topward angler make corkes fashion nutmeg small end bigge middest much onely little sooner apt sinke may thereby strike fish haue fully bitten others shape corkes fashion whirle little apple round flat side corke amisse angle great fish apt sinke flote till hooke fastened fish beginneth shoot away bait angler striking seldome neuer loose labour next instrument belongeth angle hookshookes diuers shape bigge little meane betweene according fish angle best thing make hook either old spanish needle strong wyar drawne neere hardnesse temper nayled allayed fire may bend anie way best way soften wyar worke hold blaze candle till red hot let coole softly gently selfe thus roule wyar vp put charcoale fire till red hot let coole leisure touching making hooke shall onely paire plyars bend proportion please sharpe file make point eard sharpe may batter lower end flat must hook two hook one piece wyar turned contrarie way one double hooke must fastened like single line strong wyar ioyned vnto handfull long well wound warped smaller wyar another wyar length warped aforesaid linkes ioyned together line fastened last linketo fasten ookes called armed hooke desend hooke shearing biting piece teeth greater fish single hooke shall thus fixe vnto line take length twisted haires containing number fit hooke hauing made loope one end lay end vpon inside hooke silke thred colour line whip warpe hooke round thicke close strait may running last end whole warpe draw fast cut away close warpe ooke thus fastenedto plumbe lin shall plumbe line fasten certaine piece lead according bignesse line length quar er ynch halfe ynch according bignesse corke weight hooke plummet carrie downe hooke bottome neither heauie make corke sinke light smallest touch make corke dip water shall vnderstand first plummet would foot hooke rest aboue ynch one distant another aboue fiue seuen yet angler vse nine much materiall plumbing line three seuerall fashion plummet vsedthree seuerall fashion plummet one long another square third diamond forme yet one purpose long one euer best smoothly well fastened line feare catching hold vpon weed thing bottome water besides instrument spoke must hau musket bulleta musket bullet sound depth fastened line shall serue sound depth water angle thereby may plumbe line righter set corke due place shall haue large ring lead six ynches least compasse made fast small long line thrusting rod letting ring fall water helpe vnloose hooke ani time fastened weed stone lye bottome water shall haue smooth board six seuen ynches square cut battlementwise end vpon shall lap line shall haue boxe hooke bagge horne bait another boxe fly aliue ill sickness touching season best angle inbest season fishing aprill till end october best houres foure morning till nine three afternoone till fiue euening wind blowing north south west ayre temperate inclined warmenesse speake little particularly shall vnderstand day darke close lowring haue gentle whistling wind playing vpon water good angle fine mi zeling dew raine fall gently without violence fish bite faster also flouds gone away riuers come within owne bankes water clearestwinter summer fishing good angle againe summer angling shall chuse coolest time day heat good winter angling shall make anie difference time day calme houres sunne al ke onely noonetide esteemed best water angle ebbe low best time angling ebbing water place yde great time flowing preferred also lastly whensoeuer see play leape aboue water pike shute pursuit he verie good time angle time season contrarie rehearsed vild naught angle knowledge seasonsthe best maner fishing shall know best manner stand place bodie whilest angle angle anie pond standing water shall chuse place deepest blackest least transparent shadowing selfe vnder banke shadow may carried water euer breed fright vnto fish angle anie riuer shall chuse place deepest clearest also shall striue conceale selfe much possible standing behind tree bush anie thing else may couer next thisthe haunt fish shall know haunt fish thus carpe eele tench doe euer haunt muddie place carpe lying bottome thereof tench amongst weed eeles vnder stone couert breame cheuine pike haunt euer cleare sandie bottome pike see great store small frie cheuine streame runneth swiftest shade greatest breame water bro dest depth giueth greatest libertie also three delight pond riuers salmon hath haunt swiftest broadest riuers whose channell fall sea trout loueth smaller brooke current cleare grauellie lodgeth deepe hole doth pearch also onely abideth creekes hollow place bankes gudgin loach bulhead haunt shallow water barbel roche dace ruffe haunt deepe shadie place water mixt grauell clay firme imie loue lye vnder shadowes tree bush grow banke luce lucerne haunteth broad large meares deepe still euer lodgeth bottome thereof shad tweat haunt water brackish deepe accustomed ebbe flow haunt commonly found muller suant loue lodge close flat bottome rather clay grauell next knowledge haunt fishesbaites shall learne know seuerall bait besides formerly described indeed french secret manie may reduced two kind liuebaits deadbaits liuebaits wormes kind especially redworme maggot bob dore browne flyes frogges grashoppers hornet wasp bee snailes small roches bleakes gudgins else loach deadbaits paste kind haue exprest diuers vse yong brood waspes dried vndried clottered bloud chee e brambleberries corneseedes cherry sort fly made silke feather liuely many time deceiue good iudgement diuers dunne flie stone flie red flie yellow flie blacke flie darke yellow flie moorish flie tawnie fliethe fit time euerie bait waspe flie shellflie cloudie darke flie season seuerall baites vsed shall know redworme serue small fish yeare long maggot good iulie bob dore may browne fly iune frogges march grashoppers september hornet haue reached right hand end chayne stretched forth length said mastermeasurer shall fullow shall take vp shaft assistant hath set downe earth assistant shall proceed goe alwaies carrying chayne concerning skill measuring land whatsoeuer ground h happen vpon peece measuring vvorke greater importance haue mentioned must haue recourse vnto professed skillfull measuring chap ii manner tilling arable ground shall intreated booke ordinarily seene complexion people dwelling seuerall prouinces one great region countrie doe differ one another according aire aspect sunne called climat dwell like manner one may see nature fertilnesse arable ground ingender bring forth diuers complexion sort ordering one place another according ground shall moist glib grauelly consisting fuller clay brickie stonie free well natured vvhich thing necessarily compell predecessor inhabitant countrie alter change manner illing also fashion plough france con ines high base countrie beaun countrie normandie confines thereof sangterre berrie picardie like manner high base brie champagne burgo gne niuernois bourbonnois rotelois forest lyonois bres e sauoye againe countrie auuergne languedoc solongne groweth corne ri bordelais rothelais vaudomois ba adois generally throughout countrie anguedoc euen vnto gasco gne biscay bearne leaue prouenc bretaigne vvhich call gallo tonnant short beyond countrie mayne touraine poictou le perche conte anjou land promise country france thus countrie france likewise neighbour country great brittaine neatherlands according attration soyles found alteration tilling east part much differing west north south nay euen one selfe countrie found much alteration tillage shall said hereafter sort tilling arable ground vve haue purposed intreat hereafter short easie manner regard onely husbandrie true naturall france vvhich vve vnderstand containe whatsoeuer inclosed within bound circuit riuers oyse marne seyne purpose notwithstanding make husbandrie thereof patterno fashion sort tillage vsed country well neere furthest chap iii nature condition arable ground france concerning husbandrie france comprehendeth containeth confines called also french reacheth vnto countrie sangterre briefe compasseth whatsoeuer seyne doth ouerflow euen riuer oyse one side coasting along riuers marne aube certaine ie strong toilesome also earth found well natured easie stir blacke deepe lying high fallowes come ploughed vp hauing stone consequent bearing great store fruit againe bea eth pure wheat noble graine making bread sustaining mankind wee giue due vnto gonnesse louures poissy damp artin vnto sarcelles vnder escouan lusarche country couple horse price hundred sixe score crownes piece doe runne worke husbandrie without either called cried vpon doe certaine taske day seeing cannot endure great heat raine strong wind frost lofuly brauely kept courser light horse stable prince true ground france altogether alike country shall find much consis ing potter clay grauellie country marshie moist stonie flintie barren vninhabited hillie full wild ouergrowne rush broomes man would till bring forth corne must enrich make b ter meanes haue declared first booke v france likewise forraine country one changing husbandrie earth alter th nature qualitie therefore husbandman may know seuerall nature arable ground hee shall first know alter illage according mixture temper earth compounded speake generally earthstwo sort arth twofold simple compound loose binding simple loose earth mixt anie earth contrarie qualitie fertile black clay blew clay clay like marle marle selfe red sand yellow sand white sand sand like vnto dust compound binding earth anie clayes sand equally vnequally mixt together blacke clay red sand white clay white sand blacke clay white sand white clay red sand rest howsoeuer mixed lastly grauellie earth reckoned amongst compound earth sometimes loose sometimes binding according vnto mixture hard grittie sand mixt pebble flint shellstone said loo e drie binding wet seuerall nature soylesseuerall nature soyles shall know blacke clay fertile rich apt bring forth encrease husbanded illed sort mould may runne breake otherwise stiffenesse take away profit desireth manure rich selfe addition would make prowd corne would either mildew rankenesse lye beaten earth encrease would wither loose fulnesse would plowed thrice wheat fallowed may day summerstirred sowne michaelmas would plowed foure time ba ly fallowed summerstirred aforesaid winterrigd michaelmas sowne march aprill following would plowed pea beanes plowday suffered lye bait till mid februarie sowne without plowing onely harrowed oat rye great friend yet vvill beare carefull husbandrie rye sort doth wheat oat doth barley blew clay clay like marle marle selfe fully rich blacke mould therefore endure manured time vvhen leasure vvill serue must plowed manner time seed plow blacke clay also friend rie oat simple sand meanes verie fruitfull corne onely bring forth increase great labour trauell seldome beare wheat especially red yellow sand except lye neere sea coast else haue mixture corne joy rye must plowed foure time fallowed ianuarie summerstirred aprill foyled iune sowne michaelmas barley must plowed sixe time fallowed summerstirred foyled aforesaid winterrigged michaelmas cast downe februarie sowne may speake generally barren hot loose earth vvould seldome lye still plowed oft leasure vvill giue leaue beanes pea neuer beare tare fetch lupine vvill beare vvith plowing vvhich onely vvhen sowne aprill soyles must vvonderfully vvell manured longer haue much heart thereof vvill beare corne lastly grauelly ground vvhat mixture soeuer somewhat better wheat sand yet rie chiefe seed must thing vsed like sand ground vvill beare wheat vvith husbandrie beares rie compound binding earth fertile barren according mixture vvhen richest clay mixt richest sand namely blacke clay vvith red sand held good ground likewise vvhen vvorst clay mixt vvith vvorst sand blew gray clay vvith sand vvhich like dust held verie barren ground consequently rest clayes sand also clayes themselues vvhen blacke clay mixt blew clay marle vvith gray clay sand vvhen red mixt vvith vvhite yellow vvith blacke grauell vvherein shall note much good soyle lesse bad much lesse fertile tillage sand mixt vvith clayes clayes vvith clayes vvill beare graine wheat rie maslin barley oat pea husbanded vvell throughly manured onely must plowed sort plow sand sand vvhich mixt vvill beare onely rie small pulse plowed like rest beforesaid conclude clayes naturally cold moist sand hot drie mixed soyles lesse according mixture thereof chap iiii space largenesse arable ground would haue desire cornegrounds faire sight make goodly shew easie tilled beare plentifully part many peeces cast foure square let neuer one exceed length fortie pole yet lesse thirtie fiue twentie inconuenientnesse place vvill suffer cast square make somewhat long yet exceeding foresaid fortie pole length besides infinite commodity pleasure accompanying short field large reach one verie speciall profit namely ox horse doe labour vvith lesse trauell vvearisomnesse much onely cheere vp themselues take breath end furrow also plowman cleanseth freeth plow earth vvherewith woont laden also carrying enter vpon new furrow cause ground possibly may lie leuell euen besides pleasure seeing one end vvill also easie plowed dunged sowne let ditched round least side well draine away rainevvater stand cut tradewaies passenger plant within cornegrounds tree feare shadow knowing assuredly corne shadowed comforted rejoyced sunne also hauing dust vvoont lye much vpon blowne vvinds likewise deliuered snow fogges tempest tentimes heauie burthen vpon backe thereof yet put case pleasure vvould plant tree thereabout let willowes like may beare great head make shadow therefore let neuer come nie thereto either poplar aspe aller vvhose shadow onely daungerous hu tfull vnto corne ground vvhich vvith great thicke great store root draw vnto best juice sucke vp fat earth steale away best seed sowne lesse ashe poysonous vnto cornegroundsashe hurtful corne farre soeuer shadow extendeth farre shall see ground euer forbeare prosper yet vtterly vnnecessarie haue tree grow cornefields plant fruit tree apple peare ceruise like shall find profit many time double injury reaped neither forcibly necessarie field cast small square ground seeing may haue large please according quantitie farme nature thereof vvhich may well lye publique common amongst neighbour priuate seuerall selfe either vvhich may make land length bredth please vvhether acre halfe acre rood herein specially noted must cast land according nature groundl nd must ca acco ding nature oyle prospect eye ground gentle earth either mixt vnmixt lye drie free winter vvater neither meanes subiect owne nature casualtie superfluitie moisture ground may lay leuell smooth plaine make appeare entire garden one land within daunger vvater subject spewing moist qualitie shall lay land high raising vp ridge middest urrowes one side according moisture lesse shall make ridge high low descent greater lesse ground besides moisture meanes much moisture subject much binding shall make land great deale lesse laying euerie foure fiue furrowes round like land making hollownesse betweene earth may light drie must doe either vpon leuells vpon descending hanging ground conclude larger field drier kept better better corne vvill prosper vpon chap v often corneground must ared plowed ouer may therefore briefly declare vnto tilling ground graine pulse vnderstand generall earings arable ground diuers according place situation said ground vve haue alreadie alledged howsoeuer case stand poyntthe first ing ground layen follow vvhat plat peece ground soeuer name behooueth first earing vvhich giuen haue rested laine fallow cleanse vvell stone ouer akes paine trauell young boyes girles doe little nothing else otherwise othersvntilled ground earth owne nature lying vntilled begett h nothing stone strong vnprofitable vveeds reliques dung throughly digested chaunged heat exalted vnto fi th degree need make doubt euen good kind ground bring forth thing mustardseed couchgrasse pimpernell mercurie thistle sort danewort vvildfetch red poppie vvild grow stinking mathweed kexes rupturewort reclaimed ground herbe called chamepytis haue sometimes seene country properly truely containe france distinguishing herbes thistle shew heat ground aromaticall odoriferous root may testifie hemlocke vvild smallage fumitorie grow putrefaction bindweed great small proceed partly drinesse partly alteration humour nightshade great small doe spring vp cold part earth vvhich draw humour thereof mercurie sort eyebright also two three differing flower small sorrell red vnderneath three sort plantaine hold cold temperate ground garden vvater cress rocket wild mustardseed also two sort vvaterparsley haue differing nature hot according humo r vvhich chey confesse participate respect propertie short certaine dalliance sport naturenature n uer idle vvhich though neuer husbanded earth would notwithstanding yet neuer abide idle without something true couchgrasse called restharrow make shew standing tenant veruaine male knotgrasse away except plow culture tyrannous commaunders doe come conclude later hearbes cut rooted oft deepe plowing must afterward especially thistle thwacked beaten small first raine may nothing yea adder remaine aliue breed increase thing againe nature soone receiue little moisture fasten claspe themselues close slime earth vvill thereby againe enter new possession within short time vvill become strong ynough strangle motherthe first aring let v therefore conclude earings arable ground cleanse stone vveeds manure spread cast abroad dung marle plow manner first earing urrow ditch clod vvith roller board couer time vvhen raine hath fallen vpon plow second earing auncient men called stirring itthe second cannot done without laying furrowesthe third third earing plow seed time sow harrow pull vp vveedes vvhich aboundance raine much rankenesse earth doe ouergrow enter common new hot corne lastly mow lay bare naked sheare cut downe sheaue gather albeit stand much vpon cleansing ground stone verie good husbandrie generall consent whole lordship towneships joyne together make terme diuers country common day common work yet must vnderstand soyles cleansed stone clayes sand haue generall mixture stone one would say stone stone scattered seuerallystones great v mani ground mixt vniuersally earth stone one equall mixture abounding one take away stone impouerish ground make bare vndesensible wind heat cold thus vvhere stone mixed equally vvith light sand keepe sand firme rootes corne vvhich taken away vvind vvould blow sand away corne leaue drie bare vvhich meanes vvould neuer sprout hillie country reflection sunne verie hot earth light stone generally mixt taken away violent heat vvould scortch burne corne vvould seldome neuer sprout neuer prosper againe countrie cold subject bitternesse frost equall mixture stone taking heat sunne giues warmth corne prospereth great deale better sooner otherwise would vvhich cause stone many time held amongst husbandman excellent manure arable land conclude though earthes sit cleansed away yet light soyle may verie well suffered seene southerly part france westerly part great brittaine chap v plow man instrument tooles carefull diligent plowman long time begin eare ground shall take good heed see tooles implement vsed plowing time readie vvell appointed may haue vse vvhen need shall namely waggon two according greatnesse farme reasonable good bigge size handsome handle vvell furnished vvith wheeles vvhich must finely bound nayled good height behind one two carres vvhich may made longer shorter according matter vvhich shall layed vpon shall require one light swift cart bodie layed vvith plankes sufficient strong beare corne vvine vvood stone matter great vveight plow furnished vvith sharpe culture part tumbrills carrie dung ground plow consisteth vpon beame skeath head hale spindle rest shelboard plowfoot culture share slipe keepe plow wearing arkerstaffe cleanse plow shall loaden vvith earth vild matter plow vvhich proper stiffe blacke clay would long large broad vvith deepe head square shelboard may turne vp great furrow culture vvould long little nothing bending share would haue verie large wing foot vvould long broad set may giue vvay agreat furrow plow vvhite blew gray clay vvould large blacke clay onely vvould somewhat broader britch hath commonly one hale belonging left hand yet may haue two pleasure culture vvould long bending share narrow vvith vving comming vp arme defend shelboard vvearing plow red sand would lesse spoken light nimble culture would made circular much bending like white clay yet much thinner share vvould made halfe vving neither large black clay narrow white clay meane plow white sand differs nothing red sand oft hath one addition end beame paire round wheeles bearing beame vpon loose mouing axletree length two furrowes doth certainely guide plow true furrow neuer loose land swa ing take much land greedinesse yrons culture share plow like red sand onely little lesse culture fully long much bent share broad little sharper pointed plow also serueth grauell howsoeuer mixt whether peeble flint otherwise plow blacke clay mixt red sand white clay mixt white sand would made middle size betwixt blacke clay red sand huge first slender later meane competent greatnesse also culture share must made answerable neither bigge streight greatest sharpe long smallest lastly blacke clay mixt white sand white clay mixt red sand would haue plow point like red sand simple onely culture would sharpe long bending share narrow sharpe small like round pike onely bigge nouember time rested ground hath passed time recreation bee ground wherein chiefest kindes corne bee sowne must dunged presently end autumne ground may haue leasure receiue raine therewithall serue help seedes better rot thereby prouiding aid weakenes earth like sort rie messing ground would dunged heart winter little notwithstanding doe stay moneth march may presently receiue shower aprill may much good towards later end september time sowe fine dust windie drowthes looking first raine pu rifaction wrought howsoeuer case standeth seeing better manure ground manure ithow naught dung ground much better dung oft much field starueth dunged burneth ouerdunged consideration whereof ground must well weighed good ground hath need dunged leane ground moist field would much dunged seeing frosen continually reason moisture commeth passe dung heat doth resolue thaw thesame againe drie ground requireth lesse hot ynough selfe reason drinesse bestow great store dung vpon might cause make burnt againe exceeding rich stiffe clayes desire little manure rich fat selfe hauing anie addition presently mildeweth corne make kernell thereof blacke soot therefore good husbandman sayth manure best rich soyles good plowing due time ripening mould must likewise consideration goodnesse dung good dung would lye fast close together seasonto put dung close together rest selfe yeare elderthe diuersitie dung much worse pigeon dung best next thereto man dung especially mixt filth sweeping house owne nature verie hot next vnto ass dung best beast dung beast doth chew eat meat great leysure digesteth best thereupon also maketh dung prepared fitted put presently earth next vnto dung sheepe goat alike others horse mare ox kine worst swine dung reason great heat therewith presently burneth earth want dung stalkes lupine cut downe haue force efficacie good dung else sow lupine corneground leane come vp put earth againe turning ouer manie farmes one keepe neither bird beast make dung yet painefull better sort ash either wood coale good manure chiefely ground apt chap riue also lyme chalke especially cold soyles yet lyme would scattered verie thinne vpon chalke layd greater aboundance also seasand verie good kind manure fasteneth loose mould also maketh great deale fertile chap ix ground must plowed ouer according three earings sowne tilling husbanding earth three thing chiefely required first husbandman furnished good vnderstanding ripe iudgement secondly cattell fitted worke thirdly plough well appointed made thing verie requisite husbandman doe know nature condition earth vndertaketh till thereof reape fruit commoditie accordingly may stirre giue manie earings nature thereof doth require field good ground vnderneath must set culter plough deepe therein better fatter earth vnderneath may turned aboue whereas take course ground barren leane vnderneath altogether vnprofitable like manner manie field eared plowed become much leaner barrenner haue light mould oftener plowed time heat much pierced sunne become weaker lesse able corne true indeed manie sort ground oft earing hey become fruitfull seldomer eared howsoeuer wheat mesling especially doe desire haue three earings bee owne one called first earing must dung newly spread otherwise dung would loose force wasted consu ed heat sunne first earing stirre earth make soft afterplowing turning vp much earth plough piercing deepe earth first time cutting sort urrowes may neere together one vnto man shall hardly erceiue path passage plough meanes rootes hearbes broken die second earing spring ime earth beginneth open selfe may cast good high great withall seed may better receiued ground must vnderstand according situation ground good corne pulse also according countrey mould heartinesse hereof vsed practised small beau longboyau val de gallie valboyau niuernois bourbonnois make end ground certaine rise sufficient height betwixt said rise arable ground ditch pit made within fashion long fatt receiue water runne along great raine otherwise would rot smother corne troubleth trauell country exceedingly cause name whereby called grashoppers brie insomuch cannot tell doe well rainie day goe pull vp darnell danewort ouerspreading weedes else could hardly ouercome kind earing ground called auncient writer freeing corneground weedes hauing aboundance raine scath done vnto come layd bare yea though neuer well harrowed earth selfe strong mightie need anie rise ditch part france truly properly called neither isle thereof flat free countrey blairie longboyau labea ce verie barne storehouse france country oye sangterre else berry free poictou grauellie country may well excused freed manner inconuenience appeareth manie place picardie solongne euen vnto percheron make furrowes close neere one another wont done low ground valleyes ground must also plowed fit conuenient time end may become fruitfull wherefore carefull husbandman shall neuer plow ground while wet running plough time doe nothing runne vpon heapes especially tough clammie ground also hard growing putting forth fruit much maketh sad close impossible make fine small mould againe likewise absurd thing euer goe put plough dyrtie myrie ground nothing fit stirre deale anie manner way withall become drie vnfit though could doe would vnto plough yet casting anie seed fall anie tree vin plant ground must passe ouer lifting vp plough shootes come rootes time perceiue selfe vpon shall cut hatchet rather bruise breake culter feare breaking culter selfe putting ox horse paine chap x attell vsed plow withall doe differ according manner custome country rough tough groundsplowing horse also free kindly ground hath said required needfull three horse plough fiftie foot coupled spanged country vse plow mare ox ass buffles must first caring breake clod rowler lay flat square plaine planke leane grauellie weaker ground shall stand need cost either horse man requisite draw deepe draught earth againe husbandman country haue sooner finished made end others yet doe labour leisure ayre climate countrey yet particular fashion francehorses ox france therefore speak generally according forraine soyles shall vnderstand two principall cause make man plow horse although may haue ox pleasure one liueth verie wet dyrtie soyle ground selfe yeeldeth forth continuall moisture finallest trampling treading thereupon bringeth verie myre case best plow horse draw euer directly one tread euer furrow without annoying land goe also much light nimbly cattell whereas ox going double treading vpon land would foyle make myrie would good purpose man liueth farre necessarie accommodation fuell fencing timber like necessary must forcibly vse euerie yeare case must euer keepe teame horse fittest trauell long iournies euer greatest speed least losse whereas oxe heauie beast would soone surfet indeed vnapt man hardly doe greater iniurie number horse vsed plow must according greatnesse labour strength cattell heauie stiffe clayes sixe euer ynough either fallow plow peaseearth f ure anie ardor lighter sand foure sufficient time three vpon anie necessitie mixt soyles binding craue much strength clayes loose serues light sand serue also herein noted stoned horse euer better draught either mare gelding yet good meet seruice againe worke asse oxeplowing ox uergne young mule romaine champaigne italie buffle whereas truth labour ox readie quicke dispatch time necessitie remedie helpe mischiefe must begin worke ox sooner haue greater number horse prouision ox lesse charge diet buying selling againe whereunto may adde may eat oxe sell againe haue labour certaine time true hath wrought morning must rest afternoone ox going earlier plough returne earlier labor horse greatest commoditie comming better endure vnseasonablenesse time sturdie stiffe ground draw deeper draught acquite themselues worke commendation againe raue nothing much shooing harneis country yron harneis deere neither subject vnto manie malady saue must kep starued cold raine also care taken well couered speake french ox much inured labour please looke vnto english oxeenglish oxe shall see worthiest creature plow respect constancie labour hi long endurance therein also leisurable certaine drawing without twitch keeping euer one pace without going faster slower whereas horse courage fiercenesse doth prickt forward draw rashly suddenly good hand hardly keepe euen direct f row ox fittest soyles tough firme without spewing moisture said draw double ye place moist ground shall see draw single like vnto yoakes neckes great deale better take labour much pleasure howsoeuer custome france yet endure full day labour well horse prouided driuen temperately gently nothing breedeth surfet soone ox ouerhas ie feed true much neither yet altogether well wherefore better vsed leane ground except yong mule auuergne exceedeth beast troublesome hard brought draw brainsick yong mule hath madding fit vexeth master pon groweth vse say namely good young mule curst beasta good mule curst beast plowing buffles seene romaine elsewhere good ground fat standing vpon potter clay chargeable harneis hauing short necke
