vertues property tree neither yet speake kind tree onely describe declare place ground wherein prosper grow also make knowne diuersitie amongst tree one sort one name fit planted best make shadowes walke sit know diuers sort tree grow easterne northerne southerne part vvorld vvhereof almost altogether ignorant respect diuersitie region doe grow climate mind speake purpose briefe lay downe necessarie knowne planting common tree ordinarily found owne forrests strange forraine one trouble would pleasure desirous attaine perfect knowledge manner tree growing part world vertues property nature seed may see large theophrastus fourth booke historie plant third booke vvhere hee particularly entreateth kind wild sauage tree particularly runneth nature force vertue seed manner planting euery wild tree well east north south west shall sufficient v time declare nature fiue six sort tree commonly grow country hereby kind ground euery one delighteth therefore begin two sort tree generall one called vvatertrees tree delighting grow neere vnto brinkes vvaterstrees louing liue neere water medowes low watrie place land tree tree delighting grow vpon firme solid land vvhere water inundation ouerflowings vse come first speake tree liuing vvater chap xv aller poplar birch willow tree haunting water shall vnderstand foure fiue sort tree vvhich owne nature grow neere vnto vvaters except haue great store moisture doe hardly prosper grow vvhich amongst rest aller one coueteth vvater aller nature would halfe couered vvater least part rootes must necessitie within stand lower vvater otherwise would take insomuch tree nature ought planted moist medowes neere vnto brooke running along said medowes marsh ground take grow exceeding vvell tree apt take moist place vvhite vvood containing much pith putting forth great store boughes short time reason moistnesse vvaters vvherewith nourished fed said aller tree may planted two manner wayes namely either branch gathered great allers liue root digged vp place together earth set againe like ground sort halfe said root lower water vpper part couered earth depth one finger meane time planted must haue branch cut within finger length root put forth againe many young shoot manner hasel tree may read aller tree fourth booke another sort vvaterwood hereabout commonly called white woodwhite wood kind poplar birch sort wood grow close water side vpon bank ditch spring little brooke common practise italie lay conueyances pipe carrie vvater riuers throughout ground wood kind tree may easily planted young root along vvater riuer side conueniently profitably especially white poplar otherwise called aspe tree whose leaues apt shake euerie small winde rootes cannot got may stead taken faire strong plant vsed planting willowes birch doth somewhat resemble white poplar barke beech tree leafe craueth colder moister soile poplar cause groweth plentifully cold country sort vvaterwood willow vvhich wee finde proofe groweth nothing well except moist warrie countrie neere ioyning vvaters manner planting willowes commonly setting willow plant good thicknesse strength namely great one may gripe looke much stronger thicker much moe shoot put forth much stronger tree differeth much aller aller haue rootes within water willow would stand higher spread root along ground wet moist neere vnto water vvithout hauing root altogether water according whereunto continually seene willowes planted vpon causeyes bank hauing ditch water ioyning thereunto sort root may reach brink edge water proue fairer taller plentifull grow waterish medows st part root stand moist water may read holme tree fourth booke say willowes allers poplar white wood grow high place notwithstanding nature grow neere water doe prosper best place planted high place farre vvater hardly nourished put forth little growth insomuch hundred tree planted waterie country vvill yeeld vvood thousand planted drie countrey notwithstanding indeuor husbandrie vsed yea perish die great deale sooner say easie make grow husband high hillie place watering dressing conuenient sort vvhich labour performed without great cost happen neglected proueth losse spoile tree vvhereas planted place fit neere vnto vvater according nature requireth vvill prosper vvithout toile industrie man vsed therein notwithstanding much first yeares planted haue much doe shoot nourish root branch alreadie put forth wil best free twig shall put forth first yeare end may easily seed root also thereby force wind would take hold offall may shake loosen alreadie fast vpon cause tree doe many time die neuer well planted know alwaies required paine taken especially orderly conueniently planted planting p uning notwithstanding say thus much vvhich goe making close alleyes walkes shade may cause grow much short time shall effect planting furrowes one perish paine labour shall haue pleasure thereof shorter time larger manner herewithall must notedtrees must well surely planted first whensoeuer set plant tree must doe need second die would harder set others place would thriue shadow liue would cause die seeing vsually seene elder stronger one doe oppresse dogges sit chace hunting generally two kind yet particularly diuers two generall sort dogges called greyhound houndsgreyhounds hound greyhound belong leash onely coursing sort wilde beastes maine swiftnesse foot running doe thing eies gouerne vnto led naturall instinct hatred beare sort wild beast hound vertue scent smell nose find manner wild beastes following footstep leasurely moderate speede suffering beast rest till haue tired made themselues lord pray doe blindfold eies seldome neuer seeing game till come deuoure greyhound extreame swiftnesse running sheweth greedie delight hee taketh sport without opening mouth making least signe noise dumbe mute hound taking greater leasure sheweth delight pleasure hee taketh game continual clamour opening spending mouth liberall sort make wood valley hill resound eccho doubling voice amongst huntsman taken excellent musicke yet crie hound opening mouthes sort allowed liam hound long draweth string time hee must exceeding silent mute like vnto greyhound well discouerie game footstep whatsoeuer hee draweth hinder preuentions aduersarie may seeke hee hath warning giuen clamour drawing string sweetest discouerie must bee done greatest diligence priuacie speake greyhound first dog whatsoeuer noble princely strong nimble swift valient though slender verie fine proportion yet well knit coupled together seconded spirit mettall dog exc llent bitch little hope goodnesse breeding greyhound diuersities opinion gentlement leash sire ost principall bitch though dog indifferent suppose shall haue best whelp supposing according old coniecture bitch swifter dogge erronious fancie good dogge euer beate good bitch good bitch euer beate bad dogge againe certaine dogge hauing aduantage length strength courage hee must consequently haue aduantage speed also doe denie bitch much lesse dogge naturally may haue aduantage nimblenesse turnes slip wries may get much ground dogge commonly looseth yet notwithstanding full account cast good dogge equall aduantages wheresoeuer course shall stand forth long beat good bitch make giue ouer gentleman leash desire good dog respect though bitch indifferent better choice yet defectiue imperfection nature neuer fully compleate breed good whelpe indeedto breed good w lpe must sure haue perfect good dogge perfect good bitch neere make choice bitch large deepest chested thence springeth strength wind true shape good greyhound face charracter goodnesse shall esteeme dog hath fine long leane snake head cleere bright eie wide nostrells round bending necke like mollard loose cast iune hart cast head say horne true begin put forth new horne moneth aprill sunne mounteth higher grasse groweth higher also harder home grow wax greater middest iune head fully see garnished beare yeare long prouided good thriuing countrey come hurt annoyance may likewise iudge age tyne horne first yeare haue horne second yeare haue first hornesto iudge age hart horne called dagger third hartthe gate going hart huntsman shal able iudge whether hart great long likewise stand long course dogges hart haue long pace hold longer coursing haue short pace also quicker swifter longer breathed knowne hart tall longleggedthe beating hart likewise bulke bignesse bodie marking entreth thicke amongst brake small wood shall haue let passe betwixt legges looke height hath beaten downe belly high must iudge legges grossenesse bodie perceiued two side way hath touched bodie haue broken drie boughes branch side thereby may gather grossenesse greatnesse bodie concerning rubbing hartthe rubbing hart much elder much rather giuen rub vpon great tree vvherefore vvhen huntsman shall perceiue branch tree broken downe hee shall able gather height largenesse hart head howbeit darke obscure marke bywalkes therefore assured throughly behooueth haue one verie good bloudhound hauing verie quicke exquisite sent may easily find follow foot hart besides meanes must prouided huntsman ignorant place generallthe hart hath seueral haunt euerie moneth hart accustomed resort vnto although diuers according moneths yeare hart doe change vvalkes feeding euerie moneth according sunne mounteth ascendeth secretly harme thus also passe spend day night enraged feruently caried away rut thinke thing hurt also liue small namely within themselues alwaies following step footing hind next principally great must hunted huntsman deligent searchthe report huntsman vnto king hauing gotten well fairenesse largenesse hart also lodging shall come make report vnto king vnto lord haue said hunting hart belongeth vnto king prince great state indeauour representing vnto dung hart shall haue marked making rehearsall withall markes note hart hee hath seene lord may make choice appoint day houre hunting hart place hath bin foretold huntsman day appointedthree sort dog bloudhounds courser easement horseman must bee readie bee gone earely morning hauing guid dog well bloudhounds courser put set certaine place easing chace also whatsoeuer necessarie furniturethe e dog openeth followeth trace hart come place shall make diligent search find hart lodged bloudhound open also meanes may deuise inuent make choice standing dogges either courser easement haue cast couert found layre deere shall take vp lya hound first place hewed round side vvood would meanes haue deere breake passe hewed certaine companie men coasting side couert making continuall noyses clamor whereby may affright deere daring attempt come neere coast side would haue deere passe course shall made shall senet stand made tree twentie pace vvithin vvood place bowes vvhich deere shall passe may shoot according skils fortune coast shall kept secretnesse priuacie may great regard shall taking vvindhow place greyhound te sers reset bac least deere find offence hunted bowes placed next champion ground neere couert conueniently shall place teaser first brace greyhound course vvhich lightest nimblest swiftest dogges haue putting stagge vtmost speed first may lesse able endure course foorth quarter myle according quantitie ground shall place reset vvhich vvould brace greyhound somewhat stronger former vvhich comming fresh may pinch sorer make deere despaire safetie lastly quarter myle shall place backset vvhich vvould two strongest forest biting greyhound get vvho taking aduantage stagges wearinesse comming pinch may hold vvithout suffering tunne haue thus placed course shall take hunting hound vncoupling cast couert encouraging horne voice till haue deere foot hunt himdirections hunt deere hound onely till haue brought take end bowes course make vse either bowes greyhound onely intend hunt stagge force hound onely soone haue cast hound got stagge foot shall diligent meanes get sight soone possible vpon view take speciall true knowledge vvhensoeuer shall crosse may know anie deere vvhatsoeuer shall giue good heede vnto manner hunting vnto sleight vvhich hee vseth chase vvhich vvee shall speake seuerally hereafter case hound may ouerhaled vvearied long standing stagge shall bee amisse haue hound easement conuenient place vvhich may cast middest day relieue former make chase royle much shorter hart perceiued horsemendogges easement rested runne others wearie winded bloud hound must place dogges easement three foure seuerall stand certaine place end may ease dogges wearie running haue lost farre behind others leading way rest great stoutnesse courage dogges easement placed standing conuenient coursing dogges must vncoupled runne regard according place hart seene horseman tending vpon dogges presently vncouple companie dogges easement hallowing whupping dogges continually casting bough tree way hart passe pe ceiue companie coursing dogges neither yet heare noise men hunting hee hunter casteth first way breake meanes ormer trace thereby mocke dogges hee entreth large wide way followeth long strength endure auoid sleight horseman must haue eie hart shall fall companie beast sort fox sufficiently knowne hoglike brocks whitish haue haire aboue nose vnder throat great deale white doglike haue bodie greater bulke head snowt also grosse hoglike going den freely dung euermore doglike doglike make aboad tougher earth else rockes making hole den deeper narrower hoglike cannot dig stiffe tough earth rockes sand light ground doglike haue nose throat eares yellowish manner earthdogstwo sort earthdogs two sort one hath crooked lege nd commonly short haire hath straight leg shagd haire like waterspannyels haue crooked leg creepe easily earth best brocks stay long keepe better without comming forth haue straight leg serue two v run coursing dog ground also take earth boldly tarrie long vexe themselues fighting fox brockes whereby forced come forth take aire fall huntsman haue earth dog readie taught hee may traine manner time begin take hand must bee betwixt age eight ten moneths brought take earth yeare old scarce euer able bee made take againe must roughly dealt withall time training neither handled may take hurt brockes earth beaten hardly handled would neuer ak earth cause must bee carefully looked vnto young trained dog bee neuer made take earth old foxe brocks let first stay yere throughly nurtured furthermore must old earth dog put alwaies indure beare furie brocke conuenient readiest way traine thus time fox brocks haue young one must take old earth dog let take earth afterward shal begin stand abbaie must young one brought vnto mouth hole one one feare beate themselues cause heare abbaie old brockes fox shall taken none remaining cub must take vp couple vp old earth dog let loose young one incouraging take earth cry vnto creepe basset creep hou take take haue hold young brocke foxe must bee let alone till haue strangled burrow hole taking heed earth fall vpon least might hurt afterward must carie yong brocks fox vnto lodging cause liuers bloud also bee fried cheese fat making meate thereof shewing head wild flesh may also trained taught another manner namely must cause old brocks fox taken aliue old earth dog pincer fit purpose take breake teeth neather iaw wherein great gripers stand touching vppermost end may continually appeare seene rage furiousnesse beastes although able harme therewith afterward shall cast earthes meadow plot sufficient largenesse dog turne themselues go couple brest couering burrowes afterward boords greene turfes done brocke must put dog young old let slip incouraged hath alreadie beene said haue baited sufficiently must strike seuen eight great blowes vpon side hole spade harden acquaint therewith time shall stand neede vse deluing must take vp plankes ouer place brocke taking hold vpon pincer killing else causing stifled greyhound may meat bee made must haue cheese must cause cast presently wild flesh shall dead peraduenture would breake teeth neather iaw brocke yet must cut greater master teeth may kept biting mischiefe chap xxxviii manner killing foxe killing foxe ch easie brocke herein especially seeing scent dogges baite gather themselues together rush vpon sodaine except time female hath young one forsake naturally giuen dig earth place hard diggedthe foxe borow rockes vnder root tree haue one hole strait reacheth far huntsman opinion sure likely credible foxe neuer maketh owne earth kennell though bee subtilest beastes touching owne saftie gaining pray yet nothing laborious giuen take paine thing bellie onely neither hath nature giuen especiall instrument vse mungrell dogges kind may scrach digge vp earth little hiding maine couering pray make fearefulnesse doth first make fox earth determinate purpose foxe inioy place refuge rest himselfe onely soone foxe findeth presently watcheth going badger entring holeby mean fox commeth haue great owne negligence male gerfaulcon called ierkin much lesse bird yet exceeding good mettall courage sit flie riuer hawke vvhatsoeuer hauing naturall loue manner water foule continually vvild making prey quantitie fox taile hanging thereat thus letting fle plaine ground giue kite occasion stoope vvhen kite aduised ducke stoopeth vnto ground drawing neere vnto doth keepe himselfe without thing beholding maruelling forme sacre cast thinking himselfe swift hopeth flight ouertake wherupon kite mounteth vpward turning round therewithall much combate becommeth pleasant behold especially plaine disease pthisis bird troubled disease swelle h bodie hauing euerie beset veines full bloud breast notwithstanding thin leane furthermore bird diseased doth nothing take ast away ouerturne meat hempeseed gow another sort disease common vnto bird vexing ore diseased thereof neither stirre stand paine doe endure disease knowne roughnesse legges foot difficultie breathing hard drawing breath troubleth also knowne hoar ene e cannot vtter ne doe yet h rshly imperfectly else saying thing shall lay hand vpon breast also shall perceiue shall feele extraordinarie beating shewing selfe come called asthma shortnesse breath bird also oftentimes fall blind vvhich quickly helped vvill neuer cured disease perceiued trickling teares eye certaine feather eye vvhich doe curle crooke turning
